0.title: Sweden & Finland are allies, they can count on us: Hungary on NATO bid
0.article_body: Hungarian Prime Minister's Chief of Staff Gergely Gulyas has said that the country's parliament will discuss ratification of Finland and Sweden's NATO bids during its autumn session, mentioning that the two countries are "allies and they can count on us". Hungary and Turkey are the only two NATO members who haven't cleared the Nordic nations' bid to join the alliance.

1.title: Jacqueline might flee India, not cooperating in investigation: ED
1.article_body: Opposing Jacqueline Fernandez's bail petition in Patiala court, the Enforcement Directorate said that if she is given bail, she might attempt to flee the country. The ED also alleged that she is not cooperating in the investigation and accused her of tampering with evidence. Jacqueline is one of the accused in the ₹200 crore extortion case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar.

2.title: Lalu's daughter Roshni to donate him kidney, RJD chief to visit Singapore: Report
2.article_body: Ailing RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's Singapore-based daughter Roshni Acharya will donate a kidney to her father, PTI reported citing a close family member. The 74-year-old Bihar leader returned last month from Singapore where he had gone for treatment for his kidney problems. According to reports, Yadav is likely to visit Singapore in November for the kidney transplant.

3.title: Man named Salman Khan performs 42 backflips at Mumbai beach; video viral
3.article_body: A video of a man performing 42 backflips in one go at Mumbai's Juhu beach has gone viral online. The man, named 'Salman Khan', posted the video of his gymnastics skills on Instagram and wrote, "How many flips? Next time with more power." A netizen commented, "Next level Mumbai Ka Tarzan." Another said, "You can break the world record."

4.title: Virat Kohli becomes first cricketer in history to score 4,000 runs in T20I cricket
4.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the first cricketer in history to score 4,000 runs in T20I cricket. Kohli reached the milestone during his 40-ball 50-run knock in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England in Adelaide on Thursday. Kohli has now hit 38 50-plus scores in 107 innings in T20I cricket.

5.title: Indian man relocates to Canada for job at Meta, fired 2 days after joining
5.article_body: A man who relocated from India to Canada for a job at Meta was fired two days after his joining. Sharing a post on LinkedIn about the same, IIT-Kharagpur graduate Himanshu V wrote, "What's next for me? Honestly, I have no idea! I'm looking forward to whatever comes next." On Wednesday, Meta Platforms fired over 11,000 of its employees worldwide.

6.title: I find this extremely pointless: Jet Airways CEO on Twitter's 'Official' label
6.article_body: After Twitter launched the "official" verification label before taking it down abruptly, Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said, he finds it "extremely pointless". "I am one of those who finds this extremely pointless. Why not just have a $ sign or something for paid subscribers, and retain the blue tick for verified accounts? It is not rocket science," Kapoor tweeted.

7.title: My arrest was political, didn't see such political vendetta earlier: Raut
7.article_body: A day after his release from Mumbai’s Arthur Road jail in a money laundering case, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said his arrest was "political". "The country has never seen this kind of politics. Our country was under foreign rule for 150 years but we did not see this kind of political vendetta in the country," Raut added.

8.title: Sharad Pawar not to join Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra: Jairam
8.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday said that NCP chief Sharad Pawar won’t be joining the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Friday due to health issues. "He was recently hospitalised, Rahul Gandhi and I talked to him. The doctor has recommended a three to four-week rest," Ramesh added. Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray will join the yatra tomorrow, Ramesh stated.

9.title: Satyendar Jain should be shifted to UP or H’yana jail from Tihar: BJP MP
9.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma demanded that Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain should be shifted from the Tihar Jail. "He should be shifted to some other jail in Haryana or UP because Jain has made Tihar a den of corruption," Verma said. Jain is in jail in connection with a money laundering case against him.

10.title: Why haven't you arrested Jacqueline yet, why pick-and-choose: Delhi court to ED
10.article_body: Hearing bail application of Jacqueline Fernandez in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, a Delhi judge on Thursday warned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) not to implement a "pick-and-choose policy". "Why haven't you arrested Jacqueline yet despite issuing an LOC? Other accused are in jail," court told ED. The court is likely to announce its decision tomorrow on Jacqueline's bail request.

11.title: Apple restricts 'Everyone' option in AirDrop to 10 minutes in China
11.article_body: Apple has restricted the "Everyone" option in the AirDrop file-sharing feature to ten minutes in iOS 16.1.1 update on iPhones purchased in China. While Apple didn’t comment on why this was done in China, it's said that protesters in the country used the service to spread posters opposing Xi Jinping and the Chinese government.

12.title: 3 cattle smugglers injured after being chased by gau rakshaks in Gurugram
12.article_body: Three suspected cattle smugglers suffered injuries after their pick-up truck overturned while being chased by gau rakshaks in Gurugram on Thursday, police said. In a purported video of the incident, the accused were allegedly seen throwing cows on the road to escape, said Mohit Yadav, a member of the Haryana government's cow protection task force.

13.title: Duo kidnaps businessman's son in Ghaziabad, demands ₹20 lakh ransom
13.article_body: Two men kidnapped the three-year-old son of a real-estate businessman from outside his house in Ghaziabad on Tuesday. Later, they called up the child's family, demanding a ransom of ₹20 lakh for his release. However, police through electronic surveillance tracked the suspects and nabbed them when they came to take the ransom. Police handed over the boy to his family.

14.title: Qatar unveils 6,000 cabin World Cup fan village in desert
14.article_body: Qatar on Wednesday unveiled a 6,000-cabin fan village in an isolated lot near its airports. The area could hold as many as 12,000 people if booked at capacity, officials said. Around 60% of the cabins are already booked for the tournament, said Omar al-Jaber, the head of accommodation at Qatar's Supreme Committee for Delivery and Legacy for the tournament.

15.title: Akshay Kumar to have a cameo in Ayushmann's 'An Action Hero': Report
15.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar will reportedly have a cameo appearance in Ayushmann Khurrana's upcoming film 'An Action Hero'. "Akshay has already shot for an important appearance in the film, which brings about a change in Ayushmann's character and perspective," a source told Bollywood Hungama. The Anirudh Iyer directorial will release on December 2, 2022.

16.title: ED dancing to tune of PM Modi, Shah: Congress on Sanjay Raut case
16.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that the PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act) court made scathing observations on the behaviour of ED in the Sanjay Raut case. "Now, there is ample evidence to show that the ED is not a professional agency and dances to the tune of the Prime Minister and Home Minister," he said.

17.title: Mumbai Police ban flying of drones, other objects in city till December 12
17.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday banned the flying of drones and other devices in the city from November 13 to December 12. "No flying activities of drones, remote-controlled micro-light aircraft, para-gliders, para motors, hang gliders, hot air balloons, private helicopters, etc. shall be allowed," the order stated. With this, Mumbai Police aim to maintain law and order situation in the city.

18.title: Dislocated shoulder twice: Janhvi on 'Mr & Mrs Mahi' prep
18.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor shared that she dislocated her shoulder twice while playing cricket as a part of her preparation for 'Mr & Mrs Mahi'. The film, which will also feature Rajkummar Rao, is directed by Sharan Sharma and will star Janhvi as a cricketer. Apart from 'Mr & Mrs Mahi', Janhvi will also be seen in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Bawaal'.

19.title: BJP fields ex-MLA who jumped into river to save lives after bridge collapse in Morbi
19.article_body: BJP has fielded Kantilal Amrutiya, a former MLA from Morbi, who reportedly saved lives after the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy by jumping into the river, for the upcoming Gujarat polls. Amrutiya had won the Morbi Assembly seat in 1995, 1998, 2002, 2007 and 2012. Amrutiya has replaced Brijesh Merja, the current MLA of Morbi, as BJP's candidate from Morbi.

20.title: Around 6,000 police personnel to be deployed for PM Modi's protection in B'luru
20.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will arrive in Bengaluru tomorrow to take part in multiple events, including a public rally, and around 6,000 police personnel will be deployed for his security arrangement, the police said. PM Modi will arrive in Bengaluru's HAL airport at 9 am and will leave for Madurai Airport in Tamil Nadu at 1.45 pm, as per reports.

21.title: Sequoia Capital marks down its entire $214-million investment in FTX to $0
21.article_body: Venture capital firm Sequoia Capital said that it's marking down the full value of its investment in FTX to zero dollars amid uncertainty over the crypto exchange's liquidity crunch. The VC firm put in $213.5 million last year in FTX’s international and US businesses. Sequoia added, "The full nature and extent of this risk isn't known at this time."

22.title: Female patient beaten by drunk doctor at hospital in Chhattisgarh
22.article_body: A female patient was beaten by a doctor, who was allegedly drunk, at a hospital in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. The hospital management has issued a show-cause notice against the doctor after a video of the incident went viral on social media. The woman's son said that when he protested against the act, he was told to keep quiet.

23.title: Noida executive wanted in rape case hits guard with SUV while escaping police, video out
23.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a man running over a security guard with his SUV at the gate of a housing society in Noida to escape from police. The driver, Neeraj Singh, works as general manager at a private company and is wanted in a rape case filed by a former co-worker. The guard was injured in the incident.

24.title: Rachakonda SHE Teams arrest 125 persons for harassing women
24.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police arrested 125 persons for harassing women at various places across the Commissionerate in the last six weeks. As many as 91 cases were booked, including 28 FIRs, during this period. Officials informed that those caught were mandated to attend counselling sessions conducted by trained counsellors and psychologists.

25.title: Sensex falls over 500 points, Nifty below 18,000 amid weak global cues
25.article_body: The Sensex was trading 589.68 points down at 60,443.87 in Thursday's intra-day trade amid weak global cues. The Nifty fell by 179.90 points to 17,977.10. With Nifty Auto and PSU Bank indices down 2% each, all sectoral indices were in the red. About 1,012 shares have advanced, 2,138 shares declined and 114 shares remained unchanged.

26.title: BJP names 160 candidates for Gujarat polls, CM Bhupendra Patel to contest from Ghatlodia
26.article_body: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 160 candidates for the two-phase elections to the 182-member Gujarat Assembly, fielding Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel from Ghatlodia. BJP leader Kantilal Shivlal Amrutiya got the party ticket from Morbi, which recently saw a bridge collapse killing 135 people, while Hardik Patel will contest from Viramgam seat.

27.title: Disney's stock falls by 13% after Q4 results, worst 1-day drop in 21 yrs
27.article_body: After Walt Disney Company's direct-to-consumer arm's losses more than doubled to $1.47 billion in the fourth quarter, its stock suffered the worst one-day fall in 21 years, on Wednesday. The company's stock closed over 13% down at $86.75/share. This is the biggest one-day loss since September 17, 2001, when trading resumed after the 9/11 terrorist attacks in 2001.

28.title: Deepika's role in 'Pathaan' justifies her superstardom: Siddharth
28.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand shared that Deepika Padukone's role in 'Pathaan' is "breathtaking" and "justifies her superstardom". He promised that the film will show her in her "hottest and coolest" avatar. Talking about Deepika's pairing with Shah Rukh Khan, Siddharth said, "They've electric chemistry with each other and they look just so hot together...their jodi is a huge USP for 'Pathaan'."

29.title: Russian President Putin will not attend G20 summit in Bali: Indonesia
29.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will not attend the G20 summit in Indonesia next week, an Indonesian government official confirmed. Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, Chief of Support for G20 events, said that Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will lead the Russian delegation. US President Joe Biden, Chinese President Xi Jinping and other world leaders will attend the two-day summit in Bali.

30.title: Fadnavis has taken some good decisions, state being run by him: Raut
30.article_body: A day after being released from jail, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he welcomed some good decisions taken by the newly formed Maharashtra government. "Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took some good decisions. We feel that the state is being run by him and he is leading the state," Raut added.

31.title: Akhilesh's wife Dimple Yadav to contest from Mainpuri after Mulayam's death
31.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav will contest from Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri seat which has been left vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav on October 10. The Election Commission had announced last week that bypolls for the Lok Sabha constituency will be held on December 5. Dimple has served as a Lok Sabha MP twice.

32.title: Musk's relationships with other countries 'worthy of being looked at': Biden
32.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he thinks Twitter boss Elon Musk's relationships with other countries are "worthy of being looked at". Biden was asked if Musk's acquisition of Twitter with help from a Saudi conglomerate should be investigated by US. "Whether he is doing anything inappropriate, I'm not suggesting that," Biden further said.

33.title: I'm not dead: Britney Spears on people wanting to do her biopic
33.article_body: After Millie Bobby Brown expressed her wish to play Britney Spears in a film, the singer took to Instagram and reacted indirectly to the statement. "I hear about people wanting to do movies about my life. Dude, I'm not dead," she said. Millie, on Drew Barrymore's talk show, said she feels she can tell Britney's story in the right way.

34.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England
34.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final match. India are fielding the same playing XI that played against Zimbabwe in their last Super 12 stage match. England have made two changes, with Phil Salt and Chris Jordan replacing Dawid Malan and Mark Wood.

35.title: Noida authority to organise e-bidding of 2 group housing plots
35.article_body: The Noida authority said that it is likely to organise an e-bidding of two group housing plots on sale in a scheme on November 11. These two plots are located in Sector 146 and 151 along the Noida Expressway. The plot sizes for group housing projects range between 18,960 square metres and 94,202 square metres, according to officials.

36.title: India featuring in a World Cup knockout match without MS Dhoni for first time in 19 years
36.article_body: India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final is India's first knockout match in an ICC World Cup (both ODI and T20I) without MS Dhoni in 19 years. The last time India played a white-ball knockout match without Dhoni in ICC tournament was 2003 World Cup final. Dhoni featured in India's all previous 11 knockout matches in World Cups, captaining in 10.

37.title: No one allowed to disturb peace: Punjab CM on Bargari sacrilege accused's killing
37.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said no one will be allowed to disturb the peace of the state after Bargari sacrilege incident accused and Dera Sacha Sauda follower Pardeep Singh was shot dead in Faridkot district. "Strict instructions to the civil and police officials to maintain the peace and tranquillity of the state," CM Mann tweeted.

38.title: Malaika Arora's 'I said yes' post sparks rumours of engagement with Arjun Kapoor
38.article_body: Malaika Arora sparked rumours of engagement with Arjun Kapoor as she took to Instagram to share a picture of herself, and wrote "I said YES." Several celebrities took to the comments section to wish Malaika and Arjun all the best. "Woah woah woah!!" wrote actor Karan Tacker, while stylist Tanya Ghavri commented, "Oh my god."

39.title: Twitter pauses 'Official' tag on accounts, says 'we are going after impersonation'
39.article_body: Twitter Support account on Thursday tweeted, "We're not currently putting an "Official" label on accounts but we are aggressively going after impersonation and deception." Earlier, Elon Musk tweeted that he "killed" the new 'Official' label for Twitter accounts, on the same day that it began rolling out. He also said, "Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months."

40.title: Suryakumar can be dismissed by forcing him to hit over mid-on: Malik
40.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik said Suryakumar Yadav can be dismissed by being forced to play shots over mid-on. "You should bring the mid-on player closer and make the mid-off fielder move further," added Malik. Sharing his opinion on the manner in which Suryakumar can be dismissed, ex-Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said, "[One should] ensure that he doesn't have much width."

41.title: Was 17-18, started shaking when I walked on set: Priyanka on her 1st film
41.article_body: Sharing her experience of shooting for her Bollywood debut 'The Hero', actress Priyanka Chopra said, "I was 17 or 18...When I walked on the set with Sunny Deol, I was shaking...It wasn't my reality." "I didn't know what was thrust upon me," added Priyanka. "I...watched movies but I didn't think I could ever be in them," she stated.

42.title: Bargari sacrilege accused shot dead by 5 gunmen in Punjab, video surfaces
42.article_body: Bargari sacrilege incident accused and Dera Sacha Sauda follower Pardeep Singh was shot dead by five gunmen in Punjab's Faridkot district on Thursday. Police said Singh's security personnel also fired in retaliation and three people were injured in the incident. Key accused in Sidhu Moosewala's murder, gangster Goldy Brar, has taken the responsibility of killing Pardeep Singh on social media.

43.title: Mumbai-based startup QubeHealth raises pre-Series A funding
43.article_body: Healthcare-focused fintech company QubeHealth﻿ raised an undisclosed pre-Series A round led by the US-based New Horizon Ventures, ThinKuvate (Singapore) and Keiretsu Forum, an existing investor. The funding round saw the participation of Axiomatic Ventures, Inflection Point Ventures and angel investors from India and the US. Founded in 2019, QubeHealth is headquartered in Mumbai.

44.title: Expect Putin to talk seriously about prisoner swap for Griner: Joe Biden
44.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said he expected Russian President Vladimir Putin to be willing to talk more seriously with Washington about prisoner swap for US basketball player Brittney Griner's release. "My intention is to get her home," Biden added. Griner was arrested at Moscow airport when vape cartridges containing cannabis oil, banned in Russia, were found in her luggage.

45.title: Vivek Agnihotri announces 'The Vaccine War', to release in 11 languages
45.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri announced his next film, titled 'The Vaccine War'. The filmmaker said the story represents a "true story of war that...India fought and won with its science, courage and great Indian values". The film will release in 11 languages, including Bangla, Gujarati, Marathi and Bhojpuri. It will be produced by Pallavi Joshi and Abhishek Agarwal.

46.title: India reports 1,016 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 13,187
46.article_body: India reported 1,016 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 811 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases in India stands at 13,187. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,514, according to the ministry.

47.title: AAP gives ads worth ₹5,000 for ₹5 work: BJP's Tejasvi Surya
47.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and said that Arvind Kejriwal's party spends ₹5,000 on publicity for doing work worth just ₹5. "You need to stay wary of such people. They are not only ruining their own lives, but also ruining the country," said Surya during an interaction with the first-time voters of Gujarat.

48.title: US-based startup Equals raises $16 million in Series A funding round
48.article_body: US-based spreadsheet platform Equals has secured $16 million in Series A funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. The funding round saw participation from Craft Ventures and BoxGroup. In July, the startup had raised $6.6 million in a seed round led by David Sacks of Craft Ventures. The platform was co-founded by Ben McRedmond and Bobby Pinero.

49.title: Draft electoral rolls of constituencies in Hyderabad published
49.article_body: The electoral registration officers on Wednesday published the draft electoral rolls of Hyderabad's 15 assembly constituencies. "Voters can verify their names and submit their claims and objections, if any, to the concerned electoral registration officers from November 9 to December 8," a senior GHMC official said. Voters can verify their names online by visiting the CEO Telangana's website.

50.title: 9 Indians killed in fire in Maldives
50.article_body: Nine Indians have been killed in a fire in Maldives' capital Male, according to reports. At least ten people have been killed in the fire that broke out in a building, officials said. The disaster management agency said an evacuation centre has been setup and arrangements are being made to provide relief assistance and support.

51.title: No team has ever won a T20I after winning toss at India's T20 WC 2022 semi-final venue
51.article_body: India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final will take place at Adelaide Oval. A total of 11 T20Is have taken place at the venue so far. No team has ever won a T20I at Adelaide Oval after winning the toss. Further, team batting first has won seven T20Is at Adelaide Oval, while team batting second has won four.

52.title: Snoop Dogg announces his biopic, says 'waited for a long time'
52.article_body: Universal Pictures on Wednesday announced Snoop Dogg's biopic, which will be produced by the rapper himself. Snoop Dogg said he waited for a long time to put his biopic together as he wanted "to choose the right director, the perfect writer and the greatest movie company" that could understand his legacy. The biopic will be directed by Allen Hughes.

53.title: Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba to contest Gujarat Assembly elections on BJP ticket
53.article_body: Cricketer Ravindrasinh Jadeja's wife Rivaba Jadeja will contest Gujarat Assembly elections from Jamnagar North constituency on BJP ticket, the party announced on Thursday. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel will contest from Ghatlodia, while Hardik Patel is being fielded from the Viramgam constituency. BJP announced the names of candidates from 160 constituencies today.

54.title: Tesla stock hits 2-year low after Musk sells shares worth $3.95 bn
54.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk disclosed that he sold 19.5 million Tesla shares worth $3.95 billion, its shares fell to their lowest level since November 23, 2020. Tesla's shares ended 7.2% lower at $177.59 on Wednesday. With this sale, total value of Tesla shares sold by Musk since he disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, reached nearly $20 billion.

55.title: I intend to run for President again, ultimately a family decision: Joe Biden
55.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he intends to run for President again. Biden said "this is ultimately a family decision", adding that his family wanted him to run and he did not feel rushed to make a final decision. Biden also said his decision would be unrelated to any announcement by former US President Donald Trump.

56.title: A few NZ players score more runs on Twitter than on the field: Gavaskar
56.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's defeat against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, Sunil Gavaskar said, "They'll have to take tough calls. There are players who haven't...[scored] runs, yet they've cemented their places." "There are a few New Zealand players who have a big following on Twitter. They score more runs on Twitter than on the field," added Gavaskar.

57.title: Djokovic is my greatest rival as well as my most dangerous rival: Nadal
57.article_body: Rafael Nadal said Novak Djokovic is his "greatest" rival as well as his "most dangerous" rival currently. "After all, Djokovic's...[the] closest to the number of Grand Slams [I've won]," added Nadal. Djokovic had earlier termed Nadal as his "greatest rival" of all time. The two players will face off in the upcoming edition of the ATP Finals.

58.title: I've spent over 100 days in jail, what was my crime?: Sanjay Raut
58.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walked out of Mumbai’s Arthur Road jail after the court granted him bail in a money-laundering case and said, "I don’t hold grudges against anybody." He added, "I've spent over 100 days in jail, what was my crime? There can be a difference of opinion in a democracy." "We didn't do anything wrong," Raut stated.

59.title: BJP bagging huge money through electoral bonds ahead of polls: Mamata
59.article_body: The BJP is bagging crores of rupees through electoral bonds ahead of the Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh elections, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee alleged. "Every party takes bonds because they are legal. But the BJP collects crores whenever an election comes," the West Bengal CM added. On Monday, Centre approved the issuance of the 23rd tranche of electoral bonds.

60.title: This was ultimately my call: Zuckerberg in leaked video to fired staff after layoffs
60.article_body: After firing over 11,000 employees, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg addressed the affected staff virtually, a video of which was allegedly leaked by an impacted employee. Calling it one of the "hardest calls" while running the firm for 18 years, Zuckerberg said, "I'm the founder and CEO, I'm responsible for the health of our company…and this was ultimately my call."

61.title: See this happens in Parliament, says Rahul Gandhi and turns off his mic
61.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday, while addressing a meeting in Maharashtra’s Nanded, switched off his microphone, saying "And see what happens with us in Parliament." He added, "We started this Bharat Jodo Yatra because media may not be in a position to highlight us." He stated, "In Parliament, if you raise issues like China...your mic is switched off."

62.title: Ranbir Kapoor holds daughter in arms as they reach home from hospital, pic surfaces
62.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, along with their newborn baby girl, reached their home Vastu on Thursday morning. In the photos that have surfaced on social media, Ranbir is seen holding his daughter in his arms as Alia sits next to him in the car. They had welcomed their first child at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital on Sunday.

63.title: You put your heart & soul in this place: Zuckerberg in leaked video call to fired staff
63.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg addressed the fired employees virtually after layoffs, a video of which was allegedly leaked by an impacted employee. In the video, Zuckerberg said, "You've...put your heart and soul into this place…I want to say up front that I take full responsibility for this...I’m the founder and CEO. I’m responsible for the health of our company."

64.title: Over 100,000 Russian troops killed, wounded in Ukraine: Top US general
64.article_body: US Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Mark Milley has said that over 100,000 Russian soldiers have been killed and wounded in Ukraine. While speaking at The Economic Club of New York, Milley said Kyiv’s military “probably” suffered a similar level of casualties. “When there’s an opportunity to negotiate, when peace can be achieved...seize the moment,” Milley added.

65.title: Having no viable embryos was devastating: Rebel Wilson
65.article_body: Actress Rebel Wilson, who recently welcomed a baby girl via surrogacy, said it was "devastating" to know that she had "no viable embryos". She said that her "desire to become a mother" was "so strong" that she "needed to keep trying". Rebel added that holding her "gorgeous and perfect" daughter for the first time was "overwhelming and exciting".

66.title: EU's antitrust regulators may charge Meta over classified ads: Reports
66.article_body: European Union's (EU) antitrust regulators are reportedly preparing a list of charges against Facebook parent Meta over customer data usage and the tying of its marketplace platform to its social network. Meta's classified ads business is called Facebook Marketplace. The European Commission can impose fines of up to 10% of a company's global turnover for antitrust violations.

67.title: India, we have reached, are you ready: Shoaib Akhtar ahead of India's T20 WC semi-final
67.article_body: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, referring to Pakistan reaching the final, said, "India, we have reached. Are you ready?" He added, "It's the MCG and the 1992 World Cup-winning moment might be recreated again. I really want India to come to the final and play against Pakistan."

68.title: Who are the highest run-scorers and wicket-takers in India-England T20Is?
68.article_body: India's Virat Kohli has smashed the most runs in India-England T20Is, with 589 runs in 19 innings. He's followed by England captain Jos Buttler (395 runs in 17 innings) and India captain Rohit Sharma (383 runs in 13 innings). England pacer Chris Jordan has taken most wickets in India-England T20Is with 18 scalps. He's followed by Yuzvendra Chahal (16 wickets).

69.title: Indian social media users manipulating digital information: Experts at Europe meet
69.article_body: European parliamentarians and experts have cautioned against the capacity of social media users in India to manipulate the digital information environment for political and ideological propaganda. The online session, entitled 'Taking Stock of India's Information Manipulation Ecosystem', was attended by members of European Parliament, European Commission and experts at UK's Home Office.

70.title: India didn't need to bring in Pant, Karthik only got 1 chance: Kumble
70.article_body: Former India captain Anil Kumble said India didn't need to bring Rishabh Pant into their lineup for the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe. "It was not like Dinesh Karthik got chances and did not score. He only got a chance in one game," added Kumble. "Now since Pant has been introduced, he should continue playing," he stated.

71.title: UK PM Sunak's close ally resigns over abusive texts; told official to 'slit throat'
71.article_body: UK minister Gavin Williamson, a close ally of PM Rishi Sunak, resigned from the Cabinet on Wednesday. Williamson had been accused of acting in a bullying manner, sending expletive-laden messages and telling one government official to "slit your throat". "I obviously regret appointing someone who has had to resign in these circumstances," Sunak said.

72.title: Why are they not going to Amethi?: BJP leader on Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra
72.article_body: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi on Wednesday asked what the "fear" was due to which Congress leader Rahul Gandhi did not visit Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat for the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Why are they not going to Sardar Patel's place or Subhas Chandra Bose's place? Why are they not going to Amethi or Raebareli?" Trivedi asked.

73.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of routes to avoid for PM Modi's visit tomorrow
73.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police department has shared a list of routes where vehicular movement will be prohibited on Friday from 8 am to 2 pm during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city. Some of the routes where vehicular traffic will be prohibited are - CTO Junction, Raj Bhavan Road, Basaveshwara Circle and roads near Kempegowda International Airport (KIA).

74.title: I don't think anyone can stop Pak from winning T20 WC 2022: Inzamam
74.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said no one can stop Pakistan from winning T20 World Cup 2022, following their triumph in the semi-final against New Zealand. "Pakistan look unstoppable," added Inzamam. "[A] lot of people are comparing this to 1992. Pakistan beat New Zealand that time as well in the semi-final. They faced England in the final...That could happen again," he stated.

75.title: Use Twitter to see how things are evolving: Musk to brands as they halt ads
75.article_body: Addressing brands who have pulled advertisements off Twitter, the social media company's new owner Elon Musk said, "I understand if people want to give it a minute." "The best way to see how things are evolving is just use Twitter," he added. Several brands, including General Motors, General Mills, Audi and Pfizer have paused ads on Twitter following Musk's takeover.

76.title: Stray dog bites kid, woman in Ghaziabad society, residents stage protest
76.article_body: Residents of Ghaziabad's Panchsheel Wellington society in Crossings Republik staged a protest after two incidents of stray dog attacks were reported in the past few days. The dog bit a kid on Tuesday and had earlier bitten a woman, according to reports. The residents banned all movements inside the society gate, including that of delivery boys, during the protest.

77.title: Aurobindo Pharma's Sharath Reddy, businessman Vinoy Babu held in Delhi liquor policy case
77.article_body: The ED has arrested two businessmen from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the Delhi liquor policy case, News18 reported. Sharath Reddy, the Director of Aurobindo Pharma and Vinoy Babu, who holds key responsibilities in Pernod Ricard, a liquor company, were reportedly arrested for money laundering. Earlier, the ED arrested Delhi liquor businessman Sameer Mahandru in the case.

78.title: Shehnaaz launches chat show 'Desi Vibes...', hosts Rajkummar as guest
78.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill shared the first glimpse of her chat show, 'Desi Vibes with Shehnaaz Gill'. She revealed that she would be hosting Rajkummar Rao as guest on the show. "Dreams do come true, and today, was one such moment...I always wanted to work with the very talented actor Rajkummar Rao...I am on the moon literally," she wrote on Instagram.

79.title: If we don't try bold moves, how will we improve: Musk on changes at Twitter
79.article_body: As several advertisers paused ads on Twitter amid the recent changes at the company, Elon Musk remarked, "If we don't try bold moves, how will we make great improvements?" Musk added, "When we make a dumb move we correct it quickly that is what really matters." Earlier, Musk tweeted that "Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months."

80.title: What is India's record against England in T20I cricket?
80.article_body: India and England have played 22 T20Is against each other, with India winning 12 times and losing 10 times. India have won four of their last five T20Is against England. India's highest T20I total against England is 224/2, which they registered in March 2021. Virat Kohli has scored 589 runs in T20Is against England, the most by an India batter.

81.title: Committee to be set up to ease process of enlisting transgenders as voters: CEC
81.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar said a committee will be set up to make the entire process of enlisting transgenders as voters easier. "They are saying they have no property rights...what address they should give? They said they have stigmas, their date of birth isn't logged," Kumar said. "We'd also try to make some transgenders our national icons," he stated.

82.title: How has Kohli performed in Adelaide where India will play their T20 WC semi-final today?
82.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli has scored 907 runs in 14 innings at an average of 75.58 at Adelaide Oval, where India will face England in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final today. In T20Is, he has amassed 154 runs at a strike rate of 155.55 in two innings at the ground. "I absolutely love playing in this ground," Kohli earlier said.

83.title: Defending champions France name 25-member squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup
83.article_body: Defending champions France have named 25-member squad for the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup, which is scheduled to begin on November 20 in Qatar. France has named three goalkeepers, nine defenders, six midfielders and seven strikers. Ballon d'Or 2022 winner Karim Benzema, Olivier Giroud and Raphael Varane have been included. Notably, France's squad includes 11 World Cup winners.

84.title: NZ should think beyond him in T20s: Harbhajan on Williamson's 46(42) vs Pak
84.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said New Zealand should look "beyond" Kane Williamson in T20s, adding that Williamson isn't a top-class player in the format. Williamson scored 46(42) in New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against Pakistan. "Williamson...[was] playing run-a-ball...New Zealand should've scored more...The batters were not looking to hit fours...You've to take...chances," added Harbhajan.

85.title: Fintech startup Monsoon CreditTech raises funds led by HDFC Capital
85.article_body: Fintech startup Monsoon CreditTech announced on Wednesday that it has raised an undisclosed amount in a funding round led by HDFC Capital. Several existing and new investors, including The Sparkle Fund by DMI Alternative Investment Fund, TopShelf Equity Partners and angel investors such as Vellayan Subbiah and Akash Bhanshali of the Enam Group also participated in the funding round.

86.title: FTX going down is not good for anyone in industry: Binance CEO in email to staff
86.article_body: After cancelling its acquisition of rival FTX, Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao sent an email to his staff, which he also made public. Zhao wrote, “We didn't master plan this or anything related to it.” He added that FTX going down "is not good for anyone in the industry" and that employees should not "view it as a win for us".

87.title: Centre sends high-level team to Mumbai amid measles outbreak in slums
87.article_body: After the outbreak of measles in slum areas of Mumbai, the Union Health Ministry has deputed a high-level multi-disciplinary team in the city to check the upsurge of cases. The team will assist the state health authorities in instituting public health measures and facilitate the operationalisation of requisite control and containment measures, the Ministry said.

88.title: 3 dead, 17 injured in bus collision on Jammu-Pathankot highway
88.article_body: Three people, including a 13-year-old girl, were killed with 17 injured following a bus collision on Jammu-Pathankot highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. At least seven victims suffered multiple injuries, said Dr Bharat Bhushan, the medical officer of Samba District Hospital. "Extremely pained by the loss of lives," read a tweet from Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha.

89.title: What reasons did Binance cite to back out of deal to acquire FTX?
89.article_body: Backing out of acquiring FTX, Binance said "a result of corporate due diligence" as well as news reports regarding mishandled customer funds and alleged US agency investigations led to this decision. It added, "In the beginning, our hope was to be able to support FTX’s customers to provide liquidity, but the issues are beyond our control or ability to help."

90.title: Jennifer Aniston says narratives on breakup with Brad were 'absolute lies'
90.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston, in a recent interview, opened up about her split from husband Brad Pitt and spending years trying to have a baby through IVF. The actress said that the narratives that she "just cared about career...wouldn't give him (Brad) a kid", were "absolute lies". About her IVF struggles, Jennifer said she wanted the world to know her truth.

91.title: Citigroup to sell Nykaa shares worth ₹250 cr via block deal: Report
91.article_body: Citigroup has reportedly launched a deal to sell shares worth ₹250 crore in beauty e-commerce retailer Nykaa via a block deal involving "individual employee seller". The deal also offers a discount of up to 2% on the current market price. The lock-in period for the shares of Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Limited will expire on Thursday.

92.title: GHMC's draft budget for ₹6,224 crore approved by standing committee
92.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) standing committee gave its approval for the draft budget of ₹6,224 crore submitted by officials for the year 2023-24 at a meeting held on Wednesday. The standing committee also gave its nod to the revised budget for the current financial year (2022-23) which was increased from ₹6,150 crore to ₹6,475 crore.

93.title: Operational readiness of Army should always be at peak level: Rajnath Singh
93.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday called on top Army commanders to always maintain the force’s operational readiness at its peak level. "I have full faith and confidence in the Indian Army and its leadership," Singh said during an interaction with the commanders at their ongoing biannual conference. In a tweet, Singh described his interaction with the commanders as “productive”.

94.title: What did Mumbai court say while granting bail to Sanjay Raut in money laundering case?
94.article_body: A special court in Mumbai on Wednesday granted bail to Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut in a money laundering case, calling his arrest illegal and a "witch-hunt." The court said that Raut was arrested "for no reason" by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The court added that the main accused were never arrested, which shows the "pick-and-choose attitude" of the ED.

95.title: Working as quickly as I can on next steps: FTX CEO to staff after Binance cancels deal
95.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried told employees that he was exploring all options for his company after Binance cancelled plans of acquiring it. In a message to staff, Sam wrote, "I'm working, as quickly as I can, on next steps here…I'm deeply sorry that we got into this place, and for my role in it. That's on me, and me alone."

96.title: Nigerian national arrested 2nd time for drug peddling in Bengaluru
96.article_body: A Nigerian national, arrested last year for drug peddling in Bengaluru, has been arrested again after he was caught with 230 grams of MDMA worth ₹20 lakh. According to Bengaluru Police, the accused came to India three years ago on a business visa and got involved in the drug trade by sourcing drugs from a supply chain comprising African individuals.

97.title: Iranian actress Taraneh poses without headscarf amid protests over 22-yr-old's death
97.article_body: Amid anti-government protests in the country, top Iranian actress Taraneh Alidoosti posted an image of herself on Instagram without a headscarf. Alidoosti, best known for her role in the Oscar-winning film 'The Salesman', also held a sign reading, "Woman, Life, Freedom." Protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody are entering their seventh week.

98.title: Binance cancels deal to acquire its rival FTX, says 'It's beyond our ability to help'
98.article_body: A day after announcing its plan to acquire its rival FTX, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, said it will not go ahead with this acquisition. In a statement, Binance said, "In the beginning, our hope was to be able to support FTX's customers to provide liquidity, but the issues are beyond our control or ability to help."

99.title: Man kills 22-yr-old Pune woman after intended marriage breaks off
99.article_body: A man stabbed a 22-year-old woman to death in the parking lot of a residential building in Pune on Wednesday. The man had allegedly been harassing Shweta Ranawade since their intended marriage broke off. Police said a heated argument took place before the man stabbed Shweta multiple times. The two were reportedly in a relationship for the past five years.

100.title: Mumbai woman dies of shock after hearing about husband's death
100.article_body: A 43-year-old woman died of shock after hearing about her husband's death due to heart attack in Mumbai on Monday. Reportedly, her 45-year-old husband complained of chest pain and was rushed to hospital, where he breathed his last at around 10 am. Later, the woman went into shock, became unconscious and passed away due to heart attack at 2 pm.

101.title: FIR filed against Rakhi Sawant for allegedly using Sherlyn Chopra's objectionable video
101.article_body: An FIR has been filed against Rakhi Sawant and her lawyer Falguni Brahmbhatt on complaint of Sherlyn Chopra. Sherlyn has alleged that the two showed an objectionable video of her during a press conference, said Mumbai Police. The FIR has been filed under multiple sections of IPC and IT Act.

102.title: Russia orders withdrawal from Kherson, only regional Ukrainian capital it held
102.article_body: Russia's military has been ordered to pull out of the Ukrainian city of Kherson, the only regional capital it captured after invading Ukraine in February. In televised comments, General Sergei Surovikin said that it was no longer possible to supply Kherson city. Ukraine reacted with caution to the announcement, saying some Russian forces were still in Kherson.

103.title: Saudi Arabia announces launch of country's first EV brand
103.article_body: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman announced the launch of the country's first electric vehicle brand Ceer, which is a joint venture with electronics company Foxconn. Foxconn said that Ceer is projected to contribute $8 billion to Saudi Arabia's GDP by 2034. It hopes to attract $150 million in foreign direct investment to the country and create 30,000 jobs.

104.title: Tata-Airbus project went from Maha to Gujarat due to elections: Rahul
104.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday claimed that the Tata-Airbus transport aircraft project went from Maharashtra to Gujarat due to the upcoming elections in the latter state. "Your projects are going to Gujarat...Even the [Vedanta-Foxconn] project went [there]," the MP said in Maharashtra's Nanded. "Jobs and future of the state's youth are also being snatched," the 52-year-old added.

105.title: I don't see anything dodgy: Novak Djokovic's wife on viral 'secret drink' video
105.article_body: After a video went viral showing Novak Djokovic's team mixing a "secret" drink for him during Paris Masters final and a journalist stated it looked "amazingly dodgy", Djokovic's wife Jelena said, "I don't see anything dodgy." Reacting to a Twitter user asking why Djokovic didn't say what was in the drink, she said, "He'll talk when he's ready to talk."

106.title: SC adjourns demonetisation hearing as govt fails to file affidavit
106.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday adjourned the hearing of pleas against the demonetisation of ₹500 and ₹1,000 notes after the government failed to file an affidavit in the matter. Attorney General R Venkataramani apologised to the court and sought more time to prepare the affidavit. Advocate P Chidambaram called it an embarrassing situation. The hearing was adjourned until November 24.

107.title: Workers protest rising prices in Belgium and Greece
107.article_body: In the latest European agitation over the cost of living crisis, workers in Belgium and Greece held nationwide strikes on Wednesday, disrupting public services. The protests took a violent turn in Greece as some demonstrators threw Molotov cocktails and stones at the police. The violence was brought under control in minutes.

108.title: Didn’t know Bhide, showed him respect as an elderly person: Sudha Murthy
108.article_body: Sudha Murthy, Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy's wife, on Wednesday said she didn't know who Sambhaji Bhide was and touched his feet as he's an elderly person. "I don't know about his personal views. It's our tradition to touch the feet of an elderly person," she said. A video of Murthy touching Bhide's feet during an event had recently gone viral.

109.title: Asylum applications to Europe reach high levels of 2015: EU
109.article_body: A European Union (EU) agency on Wednesday said the number of asylum applications the continent is presently receiving has hit the high levels last seen in 2015 when over a million people sought refuge following the Syrian war. "After EU+ countries received unusually high numbers of asylum applications between May and July, this trend has accelerated," EU Asylum Agency said.

110.title: India to be self-sufficient in thermal coal production by FY25: Coal Minister
110.article_body: Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said India would be largely self-sufficient in thermal coal production by the financial year 2024-25. He said that in the sixth phase, commercial auction is being conducted for 141 coal mines across the country, including 28 blocks of Madhya Pradesh. He said the government is expected to earn ₹25,000 crore from the auction.

111.title: Don't want to see an India-Pakistan final: Buttler ahead of T20 WC semi against India
111.article_body: Ahead of India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, England captain Jos Buttler said, "We certainly don't want to see an India-Pakistan final...so we'll be trying all we can do to make sure that doesn't happen." He added, "We're all really excited about the match...It's going to be a great occasion...and these are times...you want to be involved as a player."

112.title: IMF to give Bangladesh $4.5-billion loan to stabilise its economy
112.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Wednesday reached a preliminary agreement with Bangladesh to give the country a $4.5-billion loan to stabilise its economy. The amount is expected to be disbursed in seven instalments till end of 2026. "We are getting the loan just the way we wanted," said Finance Minister AHM Mustafa Kamal.

113.title: Home sales in top 7 cities hit ₹1.56 lakh crore in H1 of FY23: Report
113.article_body: The top seven Indian cities collectively sold homes worth ₹1,55,833 crore in the first half of FY23, reporting a year-on-year rise of 119%, according to a report by ANAROCK. Between April and September 2022, approximately 1,73,155 homes were sold across the top 7 cities. The Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) topped the list with housing sales worth ₹74,835 crore.

114.title: I just killed it: Musk after Twitter users lose 'Official' label within hours of launch
114.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk responded, "I just killed it," to popular YouTuber Marques Brownlee after he tweeted that he lost his new 'Official' label released hours ago by Twitter. In another tweet, Musk said, "Please note that Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months. We will keep what works & change what doesn't."

115.title: Twitter will do lots of dumb things in the coming months: Elon Musk
115.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "Please note that Twitter will do lots of dumb things in the coming months...We'll keep what works & change what doesn't." His tweet came after he claimed to "kill" Twitter's new 'Official' label within hours of launch. Twitter senior executive Esther Crawford said, "Elon is willing to try lots of things, many will fail, some will succeed."

116.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
116.article_body: As per the IMD's latest bulletin, heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Tamil Nadu from November 10 to 13 and over Puducherry on November 10 and 12. Further, it is very likely over Andhra Pradesh from November 11 to 13, and over Karnataka and Kerala on November 12 and 13.

117.title: 5.0-magnitude earthquake hits Japan; no tsunami warning issued
117.article_body: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.0 struck the prefecture of Ibaraki in Japan's northeast of Tokyo on Wednesday at around 5:40 pm, the country's Meteorological Agency said. The agency said there was no tsunami warning in place. It added that there were no early reports of damage or casualties as a result of the earthquake.

118.title: Half-naked body of woman found with broom inserted in rectum in Haryana, rape suspected
118.article_body: A woman was found dead on a street in Haryana's Faridabad, her half-naked body showing signs of rape and brutality, police said on Wednesday. The body was found with a broom handle inserted in rectum. Police added that they suspect the victim may have been raped and post-mortem revealed that the woman, in her 30s, died of suffocation.

119.title: Dengue cases on a downward trend in West Bengal: Mamata
119.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that cases of dengue are reducing in the state and added that they will decrease further with the onset of winter. "Nonetheless, I request everyone to keep their surroundings clean and ensure there is no water accumulation, which causes mosquito breeding that needs to be checked," she said.

120.title: Man charged ₹10 extra for carrying laptop in state transport bus in K'taka
120.article_body: A passenger travelling in a North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation bus was allegedly charged an additional ₹10 for carrying a laptop. He said upon contacting his conductor friends, he came to know that higher authorities have asked some conductors to charge extra for laptops. They're at risk of being fined if they fail to levy the charge, he added.

121.title: Poor lived in kuchha houses, defecated in open before 2014: BJP MP
121.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that before the BJP came to power in 2014, the poor lived in kuchha houses and defecated in the open. India's rural poor did not even have bank accounts of their own before PM Narendra Modi was sworn into office, the BJP MP added. Thakur was addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh.

122.title: Man sets wife ablaze after argument over biryani, suffers injuries after she clasps him
122.article_body: A 75-year-old retired Indian Railways official in Tamil Nadu's Chennai set his 65-year-old wife ablaze after an argument over biryani. The woman, who suffered 50% burns, succumbed to her injuries while her husband is in the ICU. The couple lived alone and reportedly struggled with mental illness. After being set ablaze, the woman screamed and hugged her husband.

123.title: To date, SRK is among the best co-stars I have worked with: Shreyas
123.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade has said that actor Shah Rukh Khan is one of the best co-stars he has worked with. "Obviously, he's a superstar for a reason," he added. Both of them worked together in the 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om'. Shreyas further stated that he had a yes in his mind before he even heard the film's story.

124.title: Film with dad Big B is long overdue, I'd love to work with him: Abhishek
124.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that a film with his father and veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan is long overdue. "I'd love that. I'd love to work with him again. 'Paa' was the last time we worked together which released in 2009, so it's long overdue," he stated. Abhishek and Amitabh have also worked in 'Bunty Aur Babli' and 'Sarkar'.

125.title: UCC not linked to elections, will implement it: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
125.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said that Uniform Civil Code (UCC) is not linked to elections and asserted his state will implement it. He said a five-member committee headed by a retired Supreme Court judge is working on a draft, which will be ready soon. Higher judiciary is of the view that states should implement it, he added.

126.title: Farah wanted revealing clothes for background dancers: 'Om Shanti Om' writer
126.article_body: 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shiekh, in his book 'The Making of Om Shanti Om', wrote Farah Khan wanted revealing clothes for background dancers in one of the film's songs. As per Mushtaq, Farah wanted such clothes for authenticity's sake as the song was set in the 70s. "The junior artists rebelled...they'd to cover up all the cleavages," Shiekh stated.

127.title: HC tells Centre to place on record reply to 'Vande Mataram' PIL
127.article_body: The Delhi High Court has given the Centre two weeks to place on record a response to a PIL seeking 'Vande Mataram' be given equal status to the national anthem. The bench said the reply had been filed but wasn't on record. The court further asked that the matter be listed for hearing on December 22.

128.title: BR Ambedkar's statue vandalised in UP's Prayagraj
128.article_body: A statue of BR Ambedkar was vandalised by unidentified persons at a village in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said on Wednesday. Efforts are on to identify those who damaged the statue, CO Ajeet Chauhan said, adding the locals are getting another statue installed in its place. Uttar Pradesh Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation chairperson called the incident "unfortunate".

129.title: Tera number lagne wala hai: Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader gets death threat
129.article_body: Shiv Sena (Taksali) Punjab Chairman Sunil Kumar has received a death threat, days after another party leader, Sudhir Suri, was shot dead in Amritsar. The caller told Kumar, "Tera number lagne wala hai. Aur ab tera kya banta hai dekhta ja (You are next. Just wait and watch what happens to you)." Suri was shot dead during a sit-in protest.

130.title: Three JeM operatives arrested in Jammu, weapons seized: J&K Police
130.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police has arrested three alleged Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) operatives and seized a cache of arms from them in Jammu, said an official on Wednesday. The recovered ammunition included three AK assault rifles, one pistol and six grenades. The weapons were found in an oil tanker in Jammu's Narwal area.

131.title: We are fighters, will continue to fight, says Raut after coming out of jail
131.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut stepped out of Mumbai's Arthur Road jail after the court granted him bail in a money-laundering case and said, "We are fighters, will continue to fight". Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena leader Sushma Andhare on Wednesday said, "Tiger is back" as Raut was granted bail. "Our Diwali begins today," said Raut's brother Sunil Raut.

132.title: Global Dental Services raises $66 million in growth funding
132.article_body: Global Dental Services (GDS), which operates the nationwide chain of oral care clinics Clove Dental, has raised $66 million in growth funding led by Bahrain-based Investcorp. Growth investor Tybourne Capital, as well as new and existing shareholders, also participated in the capital raising round. The investment is expected to fund GDS' expansion to 1,000 clinics in the next five years.

133.title: SC dismisses PIL challenging ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's nomination to RS
133.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Wednesday dismissed a public interest litigation (PIL) challenging the nomination of ex-Chief Justice of India (CJI) Ranjan Gogoi to Rajya Sabha. Petitioner Satish S Kambiye contended Gogoi was not eligible to be nominated. "Who will decide the eligibility? You? Sorry, we don't find any merit in this plea," the SC bench said.

134.title: Police to start receiving complaints online, mobile app to be launched: Goa CM
134.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that police will soon start receiving complaints online, adding that a dedicated mobile phone application will be launched. For filing a complaint online, a person will need to provide identity proof which will prevent registration of bogus cases, Sawant said. People should be alert about the new techniques used by conmen, he added.

135.title: Man set on fire by son, daughter-in-law over property dispute in Maha
135.article_body: A 79-year-old man suffered burn injuries after his son and daughter-in-law set him on fire over a property dispute in Maharashtra's Kolhapur, police said on Wednesday. "When the...man went to the toilet, his son allegedly threw some inflammable substance in the lavatory and set it on fire," a police official said. The couple is absconding after the incident, police added.

136.title: Govt to sell 1.55% stake in Axis Bank via OFS on Nov 10-11
136.article_body: The government has decided to sell the 1.55% stake in Axis Bank held by Specified Undertaking of The Unit Trust of India (SUUTI) on exchanges via the Offer For Sale mechanism. According to a regulatory filing, 4.65 crore shares of Axis Bank will be sold on November 10 and 11 at a floor price of ₹830.63 per share.

137.title: Recruited very young team members: Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar
137.article_body: Nykaa Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar said that the beauty retailer mostly hired young talent straight from colleges. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Nayar added that while hiring, the criteria was to judge how passionate a candidate was for Nykaa. She also credited the initial success of her brand to millennial consumers who were exposed to social media.

138.title: Home Secretaries in 9 states granted citizenship to foreigners: Report
138.article_body: Home Secretaries in nine states and District Magistrates in 31 districts are permitted to grant Indian citizenship to Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains, Parsis and Christians coming from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan. The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) said 1,414 people from these countries were given Indian citizenship from April 1 to December 31, 2021 under the Citizenship Act, 1955.

139.title: Govt allows trade settlements in rupees for export promotion schemes
139.article_body: The Commerce Ministry said it has allowed international trade settlements in rupees for export promotion schemes under the Foreign Trade Policy. The changes mean benefits, incentives, and fulfilment of export obligation under the Foreign Trade Policy can be extended to export payments made in Indian rupees, as outlined by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) in July.

140.title: Twitter's new 'Official' label starts appearing on verified accounts in India
140.article_body: Twitter's new 'Official' label began appearing on verified profiles in India on Wednesday. It appeared on the Twitter handles of PM Narendra Modi, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Minister Amit Shah and others. According to Twitter, government accounts, commercial companies, business partners, major media outlets, publishers and some public figures will get the new 'Official' label.

141.title: After dating Kanye, I'm not getting as many acting offers as before: Julia
141.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has said that she has noticed a shift in her acting career after dating rapper Kanye West. "I'm not getting as many offers as I was before, weirdly. There's been a lot of weird drawbacks with reaching that level of notoriety," she added. The duo dated briefly after Kim Kardashian filed for divorce from Kanye.

142.title: NGT panel to verify 'factual position' of Narmada river pollution
142.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has formed a panel to check the "factual position" of sewage being discharged into Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Dindori district. The NGT has asked the committee to submit its report in a month's time. The NGT formed the panel as it was hearing a petition which raised environmental concerns.

143.title: Started Bharat Jodo Yatra because media doesn't raise our issues: Rahul
143.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "We started Bharat Jodo Yatra because the media doesn't raise our issues." "In the Parliament, when we keep our issues, our mics are turned off within two minutes. Our mics are turned off when we speak about demonetisation, Chinese Army intrusion," Gandhi said. Notably, the Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Maharashtra on Monday night.

144.title: Video shows students being paraded half-naked inside men's hostel in TN medical college
144.article_body: Seven medical students have been suspended from a college in Tamil Nadu's Vellore over alleged ragging. A purported video of the incident, which happened at Christian Medical College, has been shared widely on social media. The video shows students being paraded half-naked inside the men's hostel and water being sprayed on them from a hose.

145.title: Why am I categorised as mother-of-two? Am I not an individual?: Urvashi
145.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said she's always categorised as a mother-of-two whenever she posts something on social media. She added, "Why? Am I not an individual...then a mother of two kids? Does anyone say this to a man?" This comes after Urvashi posted pictures on Instagram of herself in a bikini and penned a note on body positivity.

146.title: Ghazipur landfill trash dumped nearby to show height has come down: AAP
146.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday alleged that BJP-led MCD took garbage from the Ghazipur landfill and dumped it in nearby areas to show that its height had come down. MCD Director (Press and Information) Amit Kumar, however, denied such allegations and said, "The waste from above is brought to the locations of trommel machines for bio-remediation."

147.title: China faces instability, be ready to fight & win wars: Xi to military
147.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has warned the military that the country's national security is facing increased "instability" and "uncertainty", a report said. He instructed them to enhance capabilities to "fight and win" wars. "The...military should devote all of its energy to...combat readiness, enhance its capability to fight and win, and...fulfil its missions and tasks in the new era," Xi said.

148.title: Rare pear-shaped pink diamond sold for ₹235 crore; pics surface
148.article_body: A rare 18.18-carat pear-shaped 'Fortune Pink Diamond' was sold for 28.4 million Swiss francs (over ₹235 crore) at a Christie's sale of rare jewels in Geneva. It's the largest pear-shaped fancy vivid pink diamond ever put up for auction. The auction house said an unidentified Asian buyer bought the diamond.

149.title: Gunathilaka refused to wear condom, choked Tinder date 3 times: Court documents
149.article_body: As per a police facts sheet released by a court, Sri Lanka cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka, who's under arrest in Australia on rape charges, met the victim through Tinder. Gunathilaka allegedly choked the Sydney woman thrice and also refused to wear condom. The woman underwent brain scan to check for any injury resulting from choking, the documents added.

150.title: Archana Gautam evicted from 'Bigg Boss 16' after getting violent: Report
150.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Archana Gautam has reportedly been evicted from the show after she got physically violent with co-contestant Shiv Thakare. As per a source, Archana tried to strangulate Shiv during a heated argument. "The makers themselves saw the footage and took the fair decision of expelling Archana from the game for her violent actions," the source added.

151.title: Tejashwi seeks special status for Bihar as 'birthday gift' from BJP
151.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday sought special status for the state from BJP on the occasion of his birthday. "It will benefit the state's huge young population," he said. The RJD leader was speaking at a function where letters of appointment were given away to recruits in departments of science and technology and Panchayati Raj.

152.title: PM Modi, Nadda attend BJP meet to finalise candidates for Gujarat polls
152.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP National President JP Nadda, Home Minister Amit Shah and other senior leaders arrived at the BJP's headquarters in Delhi on Wednesday for the party's Central Election Committee meeting. The meeting was held to finalise the party's candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel also attended the meeting.

153.title: Civic body allows Tipu Jayanti celebrations at Hubballi's Idgah Maidan
153.article_body: The municipal corporation of Karnataka's Hubballi has granted permission to celebrate Tipu Jayanti and Kanakadasa Jayanti at Idgah Maidan on November 10 and 11 respectively. Permission has also been granted for celebration of birth anniversaries of other national heroes and religious leaders at the ground. A fee of ₹10,000 will have to be given to the corporation for such events.

154.title: Pakistan to get $500 million from AIIB for development program
154.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Ishaq Dar said that Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) will give $500 million to Pakistan as co-financing for a development program. The fund will be used for Asian Development Bank's Building Resilience with Active Countercyclical Expenditures (BRACE) program to counter the social fallouts of economic crisis. Dar said, "The fund will be received in November."

155.title: Guj ex-CM Vijay Rupani, ex-Deputy CM Nitin Patel won't contest Assembly polls
155.article_body: Gujarat's former CM Vijay Rupani and former Deputy CM Nitin Patel on Wednesday confirmed that they'll not be contesting the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. "I worked as CM for five years with everyone's cooperation. In these polls, responsibility should be given to new workers," Rupani said. Senior BJP MLA Bhupendrasinh Chudasama said he won't be contesting the upcoming polls either.

156.title: It was a mistake: Karnataka govt on circular to bring college students for PM event
156.article_body: Karnataka government has called the circular by Pre University Education Department that directed colleges in Bengaluru to send students for PM Modi's rally on November 11 'a mistake' after withdrawing it on Tuesday. "It was a mistake done by the DDPI (Deputy Director of Public Instruction) and we have initiated action against the official," Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said.

157.title: Wake up ECI: Mahua Moitra over sale of electoral bonds ahead of polls
157.article_body: In response to the government's amendment to the electoral bond scheme, Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Wake up ECI." Calling the amendment a clear violation of the model code of conduct in place for Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, she said that the electoral bond sale will allow "more anonymous BJP donations" for the upcoming election campaigns.

158.title: Shoaib Malik, Waqar & Akram dance in studio as Pakistan reach T20 WC final, video viral
158.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Shoaib Malik, Waqar Younis, Wasim Akram and Misbah-ul-Haq dancing in the studio to celebrate Pakistan's victory over New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final on Wednesday. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Every Pakistani right now!" Pakistan defeated New Zealand by seven wickets.

159.title: It is crazy & scary what is happening today in the crypto world: Zerodha CEO
159.article_body: India's largest stockbroker Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath on Wednesday said, "It is crazy and scary what is happening today in the crypto world." He added that India's capital market infrastructure and regulations don't get enough credit for being among the best in the world. Kamath's remarks came after the world's largest crypto exchange Binance bought its rival FTX.

160.title: Activists throw cow dung on group for biryani feast during lunar eclipse in Odisha
160.article_body: A clash broke out between Bajrang Dal, Vishva Hindu Parishad, Brahman Samaj members and a group of 'rationalists' who had organised a biryani feast during lunar eclipse in Odisha's Bhubaneswar. The event defied the popular Hindu tradition of avoiding cooked food during eclipse. The activists reportedly threw cow dung on the group to oppose it, leading to a clash.

161.title: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walks out of jail after 101 days, pics surface
161.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walked out of Mumbai's Arthur Road jail on Wednesday, 101 days after being arrested in a money laundering case. "I'm happy. We had faith in the judiciary. It has increased further," Raut said after walking out of the jail. He was granted bail by a special court earlier in the day.

162.title: Kohli takes a blow on body during practice ahead of T20 WC semi-final, video surfaces
162.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli took a blow on the body during net practice while batting against Harshal Patel ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final. Kohli was hit in groin area and was seen kneeling on the ground in pain. In the video, Harshal Patel can be seen checking up on him. Kohli continued practice after recovering from the pain.

163.title: I make macho movies for SRK, others make girly movies for him: Farah
163.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan said that she is the only director who makes "macho movies" for actor Shah Rukh Khan, as per the book 'The Making Of Om Shanti Om'. Farah added, "Everyone has him doing girly movies. I hate it when he does this weepy, mushy stuff." The book was written by 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shaikh.

164.title: Ranbir, I shared our dirty secrets to gain confidence: Imtiaz on Rockstar
164.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali revealed that he and actor Ranbir Kapoor "deliberately" broke the ice between them before 'Rockstar'. "We...shared our dirty secrets, our vulnerabilities, we confessed to each other all the sh*t we were doing at that point [in] time. That way, we gained each other's confidence," he stated. Imtiaz added Ranbir was the second-most informed person about the film.

165.title: 11-year-old boy in Assam identifies man who killed, raped 13-yr-old sister
165.article_body: Police on Wednesday said an 11-year-old boy in Assam's Cachar identified his 43-year-old neighbour as the person accused of raping and killing his 13-year-old sister. The man gave police directions to the bush where he had dumped the girl's body. The boy claimed the man had offered him and his sister chocolates, but the boy declined.

166.title: Couple celebrate lambs birthday by cutting cake, inviting DJ in UP
166.article_body: A video showing a childless couple in UP celebrating the birthday of their goat's kids by cutting a cake and inviting a DJ has gone viral on the internet. In the video, the couple can be seen celebrating the event with several guests. They also brought gifts, including blankets, said Raja, the goat’s owner.

167.title: Adani Ports to buy 49.38% stake in Indian Oiltanking for ₹1,050 crore
167.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) has entered into a definitive agreement for acquisition of Oiltanking India GmbH's 49.38% equity stake in Indian Oiltanking Ltd (IOTL). The agreement also includes acquisition of an additional 10% equity stake in IOT Utkal Energy Services Ltd. APSEZ CEO Karan Adani said with this, APSEZ becomes India’s largest third-party liquid tank storage company.

168.title: K'taka Congress leader Jarkiholi withdraws 'Hindu' remark, issues apology
168.article_body: Karnataka Congress Working President Satish Jarkiholi, who faced backlash for his statement on origin of the word 'Hindu', has withdrawn his remarks and issued an apology. "There's a conspiracy to project me as anti-Hindu," Jarkiholi said and sought formation of a committee to investigate the matter. Jarkiholi earlier said he was only referring to what has been written and published.

169.title: Eggs thrown at King Charles while he greets people, video surfaces
169.article_body: A man was detained on Wednesday after eggs were thrown at King Charles and Camilla, his wife and queen consort, as they carried out an engagement in England. Footage showed four eggs flying past them and smashing on the ground as they arrived for a traditional ceremony in York. They appeared to be unmoved and carried on with the engagement.

170.title: BJP can't fool people of state with its 'jumlas': Kharge in Himachal
170.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday criticised BJP and said it may have fooled people across the country with its "jumlas", but cannot do so in Himachal Pradesh. Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh ahead of Assembly elections, he said, "People here are educated, understand everything and take a considered decision." Old pension scheme will be implemented first, he added.

171.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has come as 'Sanjeevani' for Congress: Jairam
171.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has come as a 'Sanjeevani' for the Congress. Addressing a press conference in Maharashtra's Naigaon, Ramesh said that there's a new wave of energy amongst the Congress members, workers, and supporters. They are hopeful for a bright future, seeing the success of the Yatra and people's support, he added.

172.title: Will request Centre to start Mumbai-Birmingham air service: Maha CM
172.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said the state government will request the Centre to start a direct air service between Mumbai and Birmingham, England. This comes as West Midlands Mayor Andy Street visited Shinde in Mumbai and discussed investment opportunities in Maharashtra. Street told the CM that a flight service between the cities will provide a scope for tourism.

173.title: 3 killed, 1 injured as dumper hits motorcycle in WB's Howrah
173.article_body: Three persons were killed and one person was injured after a dumper hit their motorcycle in West Bengal's Howrah district on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place when 32-year-old Deep Mondal was travelling to Ghoshal Chak along with his family. Police said that 26-year-old Papiya Mondal, 2-year-old Prithvis Mondal and 6-year-old Bidisha Mondal died on the spot.

174.title: HC dismisses plea against acquittal of Advani, others in Babri Masjid case
174.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea challenging the acquittal of 32 accused including BJP leader LK Advani in the Babri Masjid demolition case. In their petition, appellants Haji Mahboob and Syed Akhlaq called themselves "victims" of the demolition.
