The state government argued that they weren't complainants or victims in the case and, therefore, cannot appeal as a stranger.

175.title: I heard loud noises behind me: Katrina recalls fight over 'shoes' at her wedding
175.article_body: Katrina Kaif said that a fight broke out between her sisters and Vicky Kaushal's friends at their wedding. "I was hearing very loud noises behind me. As I turned, I saw everyone fighting and pulling the shoes toward themselves," Katrina said. She added she doesn't know who won the fight. "I was so busy that I couldn't ask," she said.

176.title: No access to systems, e-mail active today for farewells: Meta to fired staff
176.article_body: Meta removed access to most Meta systems for over 11,000 people it laid off on Wednesday, citing "the amount of access to sensitive information". "We're keeping email addresses active throughout the day so everyone can say farewell," Meta added. Impacted employees will get 16 weeks of base pay plus two additional weeks for every year of service, with no cap.

177.title: Voting for 7,751 gram panchayats in Maharashtra to be held on December 18
177.article_body: The State Election Commission announced that the voting for elections of 7,751 gram panchayats in Maharashtra will be held on December 18. It includes direct elections of Sarpanch posts along with member posts of gram panchayats across several districts in the state, State Election Commissioner UPS Madan informed.

178.title: Mumbai's Gokhale bridge to be reopened by September 2023: BMC
178.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday announced that Gopal Krishna Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri will be reopened by September 2023. "[The bridge's] two lanes will be opened for traffic by end of May 2023," BMC's statement read. "BMC has contacted IIT Bombay to clear the Railway Bridge design...and IIT has decided to clear [it] within this week," it added.

179.title: Oldest known complete written sentence found on a comb in Israel
179.article_body: Israeli archaeologists have found an ancient comb dating back some 3,700 years ago and bearing what is likely the oldest known full sentence written in the earliest alphabet. Written in Canaanite alphabetical script, the sentence contains 17 letters that read: "May this tusk root out the lice of the hair and the beard."

180.title: Pakistan break world record for winning most T20I matches against a team
180.article_body: Pakistan on Wednesday broke the world record for winning most T20I matches against a team. Pakistan's victory in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final was their 18th victory against New Zealand in T20I cricket. Pakistan overtook England, who have recorded 17 victories against Pakistan. They also overtook India, who have recorded 17 wins each against Sri Lanka and West Indies.

181.title: Meta's fired employees to get at least 4 months of base pay, immigration support
181.article_body: Meta will pay over 11,000 laid-off employees 16 weeks of base pay plus two additional weeks for every year of service, with no cap. On stocks, Meta said the employees will receive their November 15, 2022 vesting. For those in the US on visas, a notice period before termination, visa grace periods and immigration support will be provided.

182.title: Cong to restore old pension scheme in HP: Chhattisgarh CM
182.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel told people of Himachal Pradesh that Congress will fulfil all its promises such as restoring the old pension scheme and providing 300 units of free power. "The Congress does what it says. All promises will be fulfilled in Himachal as has been done in Chhattisgarh," he added. Himachal Pradesh will go to polls on November 12.

183.title: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried loses billionaire status as his wealth falls by 94% in 1 day
183.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, 30, lost his billionaire status after his wealth declined by 94% from $16 billion to $991.5 million in a single day. On Tuesday, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao announced that the company will acquire FTX as the latter "asked for help" amid a liquidity crunch. Notably, the Binance doesn't involve FTX.US, a separate exchange owned by Bankman-Fried.

184.title: Over 30 startup founders team up to make Mumbai 'startup hub': Report
184.article_body: Over 30 Mumbai-based startup founders have reportedly come together to form a non-profit organisation to promote startup and entrepreneurship culture and establish the city as a 'startup hub'. The organisation is expected to be named TEAM (Tech Entrepreneurs Association of Mumbai). TEAM will include founders of startups such as Pepperfry, PharmEasy, upGrad, Good Glamm Group, Zepto, among others.

185.title: 'Tiger is back', says Uddhav-led Shiv Sena as court grants bail to Raut
185.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena leader Sushma Andhare on Wednesday said, "Tiger is back" as Sanjay Raut was granted bail by a Mumbai court in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project. "These are tears of joy. Our Diwali begins today. Satyamev Jayate", said Raut's brother Sunil Raut, adding that his brother was arrested deliberately.

186.title: 11 cheat 1,700 people on pretext of giving loans in Delhi; arrested
186.article_body: Police have busted a fake call centre in Delhi and have arrested 11 people, including six women, for allegedly cheating over 1,700 people on the pretext of providing them loans, police said on Wednesday. The call centre, disguised as a medical supply store, was operational since February this year and the accused cheated people of over ₹1 crore, reports said.

187.title: Finance Ministry finalises framework to issue sovereign green bonds
187.article_body: The Finance Ministry has released the framework to issue sovereign green bonds in line with global standards. The government plans to mobilise ₹16,000 crore during the second half of the current financial year. The framework will be used to fund green projects like renewable energy, clean transportation, sustainable water and waste management, pollution prevention and control, and green buildings.

188.title: Keka raises $57 million in funding from WestBridge Capital
188.article_body: HRtech startup Keka said it has secured Series A funding of $57 million from WestBridge Capital, in what it claimed was the largest ever Series A SaaS funding round in India. The company said it had more than 5,500 customers by 2021. Founder Vijay Yalamanchili said they now want to augment the product, enhance their offerings, and improve customer support.

189.title: PM to inaugurate B'luru airport's T2 on Nov 11, flag off Vande Bharat train
189.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport's Terminal 2 on Friday, November 11. The new terminal has been built at a cost of ₹5,000 crore. PM Modi will also flag off south India's first Vande Bharat Express to serve the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysuru route. He will also unveil the 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Bengaluru founder Nadaprabhu Kempegowda.

190.title: BBMP undertakes several repair works ahead of PM Modi's B'luru visit
190.article_body: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bengaluru visit on November 11 (Friday), the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has taken up several repair works in the city. The BBMP has already laid an asphalt layer on Belathur Road in Majestic and Kadugodi. The civic body is also giving a facelift to the rear entrance of Krantiveera Sangolli Rayanna Railway Station.

191.title: BJP 'using' CAA, NRC with eye on Gujarat Assembly polls: WB CM
191.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday claimed that BJP was "using" Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) with an eye on the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "The BJP is fanning separatism in West Bengal by instigating Rajbanshis and Gorkhas in northern parts of the state," she said. "We'll never allow...division of West Bengal," she added.

192.title: Mumbai's air quality drops to 'poor' category, AQI rises to 215
192.article_body: After staying in the "moderate" range for the last two weeks, the air quality of Mumbai dropped to the "poor" category again on Wednesday. According to Air Quality Index (AQI) readings, the city's AQI read 215 on Wednesday afternoon. The Malad area recorded the worst AQI reading of 276, followed by Mazagaon with 242 and Bandra Kurla Complex with 235.

193.title: What changes is Meta making to cut costs after firing 11,000 employees?
193.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who laid off 11,000 employees, said the company will extend hiring freeze through Q1 and shrink its real estate footprint to cut costs. Meta will transition to desk sharing for people who already spend most of their time outside the office. "We've cut costs across our business, including scaling back budgets and reducing perks," he added.

194.title: 'Master chef' Gadkari fully baked 1991 reforms by lauding Manmohan: Cong
194.article_body: Criticising Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for her remarks calling the 1991 reforms "half-baked", Congress on Wednesday said that "master chef" Nitin Gadkari has baked it fully by paying tribute to former PM Manmohan Singh. Union Minister Gadkari on Tuesday said that India was indebted to Singh for the economic reforms of 1991 started by him as the Finance Minister.

195.title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami pays tribute to martyrs on Foundation Day
195.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday paid his tribute to the martyrs of the state on the occasion of Uttarakhand Foundation Day at the martyrs memorial in Dehradun. "It has been 22 years since the foundation of the state of Uttarakhand," Dhami said. "We are determined to build Uttarakhand as per their (martyrs and revolutionaries) visions," he added.

196.title: Video shows Noida woman sitting on moving car's bonnet; vehicle seized
196.article_body: Noida Police have seized a Scorpio car after a video of a young woman performing stunts on the vehicle went viral. The video showed the woman sitting on the bonnet of the car as the vehicle moved slowly on a road. The incident reportedly took place in Sector 24. Police said the vehicle was being driven in a dangerous manner.

197.title: Australia reviewing military secrecy safeguards amidst Chinese concerns
197.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles on Wednesday said his country's military has been told to review its secrecy safeguards amidst reports that the Chinese government had recruited Australian pilots. "In the information that has now been provided...there are enough concerns," he said, adding that an examination of the policies applicable to former defence personnel will be carried out.

198.title: Our Diwali begins today, Satyamev Jayate: Sanjay Raut's brother on his bail
198.article_body: After Shiv Sena leader and MP Sanjay Raut was granted bail in Patra Chawl money laundering case, his brother Sandip Raut said, "These are tears of joy. Our Diwali begins today. Satyamev Jayate!" "We were 100% confident that (Sanjay Raut will be released), he had done nothing wrong. All of this was done deliberately," Sandip Raut added.

199.title: Trees being translocated: Govt on removal of trees for Formula E in Hyd
199.article_body: After receiving backlash over the removal of trees on NTR Marg to pave way for Formula E race track, the Telangana government on Tuesday said that the trees have been translocated. The trees, including Royal Palm trees, on the 2.37 km track around Hussain Sagar Lake are being translocated to NTR Garden and Sanjeevaiah Park, the government stated.

200.title: Bengaluru Police unearths over ₹90-crore cooperative society scam
200.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested five persons in an alleged cooperative society scam with irregularities of over ₹90 crore. Kuruhinasetty Souharda Credit Co-operative Society is reported to have issued loans to some individuals without necessary paper-work and in some cases the loan amount was greater in value than the mortgaged properties. More arrests are likely in the case, police said.

201.title: Kartik Aaryan gained 14 kg for his film 'Freddy', reveals trainer
201.article_body: Celebrity fitness trainer Samir Jaura, who worked with Kartik Aaryan through this transformation for 'Freddy', revealed that the actor gained around 14 kg for the movie. "Kartik is someone with a genetically lean body...We knew it was going to be a task. But, his dedication is next level," said Samir. "He...[followed] disciplined routine workouts and...right diet plan," Samir added.

202.title: Sean Penn hands his Oscar award to Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy, shares video
202.article_body: Amid the war between Russia and Ukraine, actor Sean Penn handed over his Oscar trophy to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The Ukrainian President shared the video on Instagram. In the video, Sean said, "This is for you. It's just a symbolic silly thing, but if I know this is here then I'll feel better and strong enough for the fights."

203.title: Nobody knows how JP Nadda was appointed as BJP Prez: Congress' Kharge
203.article_body: Addressing a rally ahead of Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised the Bharatiya Janata Party. He said, "BJP always alleges that there is no democracy in Congress," adding, "I have been elected as Congress President with a fair voting system, but nobody knows how was JP Nadda appointed as BJP's President."

204.title: 2.49 lakh voters aged above 100 in India: CEC Rajiv Kumar
204.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar said that India has 2.49 lakh voters above the age of 100. He added that there are 1.80 crore voters who are above 80 years of age. "What a relief and ecstasy it gives when you interact with them and find that they have been voting all through their lives," Kumar said.

205.title: Zuckerberg explains why Meta fired 11,000 staff, says 'I take responsibility'
205.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took responsibility for firing over 11,000 employees. He said he predicted the accelerated e-commerce growth would continue after Covid and Meta significantly increased its e-commerce investments. "Not only has e-commerce returned to prior trends, but the macroeconomic downturn, increased competition, and ads signal loss have caused our revenue to be lower," he added.

206.title: Delhi's RML Hospital asks doctors to avoid casual clothes on campus
206.article_body: The Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Atal Bihari Vajpayee Institute of Medical Sciences (ABVIMS) in New Delhi have advised doctors to stay in proper attire while on the hospital campus. "Casual and party attire should be strictly avoided," said the order issued by Additional Medical Superintendent Dheeraj Bahl. Corrective action will be taken against those who don't wear proper attire.

207.title: Thank the UK government for longstanding support: Taiwanese Prez
207.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday thanked British Minister Greg Hands for visiting the self-ruled island, amidst pressure from China which claims Taiwan as its territory. "Let me take this opportunity to thank the government of the United Kingdom for its longstanding support," Tsai said. She hoped for "new heights" in ties with Britain which recently exited the European Union.

208.title: Kejriwal should undergo narco test: Cong on conman Sukesh's allegations
208.article_body: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar has demanded narco analysis tests for AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and AAP's Satyendar Jain over the allegations of conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. Kumar said, "This is...first time in the country, someone has clearly written that he has given a certain amount of money to any CM." Kumar also demanded a narco test for Chandrashekhar.

209.title: US-based startup Eliyan raises $40 mn from Intel Capital & others
209.article_body: Eliyan, a US-based chiplet interconnect startup, has secured $40 million in a Series A funding round which saw participation from Intel Capital and Micron Ventures. The funding round was led by Tracker Capital and got additional investment from Celesta Capital. The company was co-founded by Ramin Farjadrad, Patrick Soheili and Syrus Ziai.

210.title: Man stabbed with beer bottle at 24x7 shop in Gurugram
210.article_body: Four men reportedly stabbed a 32-year-old man in the abdomen with a broken beer bottle at a 24x7 shop in Gurugram. According to the complainant, Aman Sheoran, an altercation broke out between his friend and the accused outside the shop, following which they started assaulting him. When Aman intervened they smashed a beer bottle on his head and stabbed him.

211.title: Facebook parent Meta fires more than 11,000 employees worldwide
211.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta on Wednesday announced it is laying off 13% of its entire workforce, affecting more than 11,000 employees. "I want to take accountability for these decisions and for how we got here," said Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. "In this new environment, we need to become more capital efficient," he added.

212.title: Reports on ISMC Analog stake deal not related to company: HCL Tech
212.article_body: HCL Tech clarified that reports, claiming Reliance Industries Limited and HCL were independently "evaluating" deals to pick up a 30% equity stake each in semiconductor wafer fab applicant ISMC Analog, are not related to the company. However, those are pertaining to the HCL Group. RIL and HCL Group could reportedly invest through subsidiaries and total investment could exceed ₹4,000 crore.

213.title: CureBay raises ₹50 crore in Series A round led by Elevar Equity
213.article_body: Healthtech startup CureBay has secured ₹50 crore in Series A funding round led by Elevar Equity. The startup was founded in 2021 by Priyadarshi Mohapatra, Shobhan Mahapatra and Sanjay Swain. The Odisha-based company has planned to use funds to hire more people, expand to new locations and invest in tech.

214.title: Secunderabad Police recover 30 stolen bikes, 3 bike offenders held
214.article_body: The Secunderabad Police on Monday arrested three bike offenders and recovered 30 stolen bikes from them. Police began investigating after a complaint of a missing bike was registered by a Secunderabad resident on October 22. The accused were identified as 20-year-old Mohammed Awais and 36-year-old Vithanala Srinivas, who confessed during interrogation. The receiver of the bikes was also arrested.

215.title: UAE & Egypt to build one of world's biggest wind farms: Report
215.article_body: The Presidents of the United Arab Emirates and Egypt witnessed signing of a deal to develop one of the world's largest onshore wind projects in Egypt, the Gulf nation's state news agency reported. The project will help produce 47,790 gigawatt hours of clean energy annually. "The UAE and Masdar will...support Egypt's net-zero goals," Masdar Chairman Sultan Al Jaber said.

216.title: Europe experiences warmest October on record: EU climate monitor
216.article_body: Europe experienced its warmest October on record, the EU's Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) said, as temperatures were nearly 2 degrees Celsius above the average for the 1991-2020 reference period. "The severe consequences of climate change are very visible today and we need ambitious climate action at COP27," C3S Deputy Director Samantha Burgess said.

217.title: Eng feel they can contain Kohli, Suryakumar is unpredictable: Agnew
217.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Jonathan Agnew said England will believe that they can "contain" Virat Kohli when they bowl to him in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between England and India. "England know Kohli very well...Suryakumar Yadav is more unpredictable...England...have to control him somehow...He destroyed Zimbabwe," added Agnew. Suryakumar has scored 225 runs in T20 World Cup 2022 so far.

218.title: Pakistan defeat New Zealand to reach T20 World Cup final after 13 years
218.article_body: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by seven wickets in the first semi-final of T20 World Cup 2022 on Wednesday. With this, Pakistan reached T20 World Cup final after 13 years. Pakistan were the runners-up in inaugural edition of T20 World Cup in 2007 and had won the tournament in 2009. Pakistan will face either India or England in the final.

219.title: Monkey gets stuck in wheel of speeding bike in UP, video surfaces
219.article_body: A video of a monkey being stuck in the front wheel of a bike in Uttar Pradesh has surfaced online. The incident took place while the monkey was trying to cross a road and got caught in the wheel of the speeding bike. Later, the locals gathered around and opened the front wheel of the bike to free the monkey.

220.title: ED raids Telangana Minister Gangula Kamalakar's properties in illegal mining case
220.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate is conducting raids at the properties linked to TRS leader and Telangana Minister Gangula Kamalakar in connection with an illegal mining and money laundering case, reports stated. Several granite companies in Karimnagar and Hyderabad are being raided by ED following a complaint that stated many granite enterprises in the state were mining granite unlawfully.

221.title: Nirav Modi to be extradited to India after he loses appeal in UK High Court
221.article_body: The UK High Court has rejected the appeal of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi while ordering his extradition to India to face charges of fraud and money laundering in the ₹14,000-crore Punjab National Bank loan scam case. Notably, the UK court said that extraditing Nirav Modi won’t be unjust or oppressive. He is currently behind bars at London's Wandsworth prison.

222.title: Babar-Rizwan create history, become first pair to share 3 century partnerships in T20 WCs
222.article_body: Pakistan openers Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan on Wednesday created history by becoming the first pair to share three century partnerships in T20 World Cups. The duo shared a 105-run stand against New Zealand in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final to set the record. Five other pairs have recorded two century partnerships each in T20 World Cups.

223.title: Justice Chandrachud's pics with foster daughters at home before taking oath as CJI go viral
223.article_body: Supreme Court Chief Justice DY Chandrachud's photos with his wife Kalpana Das and foster daughters Priyanka and Mahi at their residence have gone viral on social media. The photos were clicked by The Indian Express photojournalist Tashi Tobgyal on Tuesday. Justice Chandrachud was sworn in as the 50th Chief Justice of India today.

224.title: TN man starts his own bank with 9 branches, cheats thousands of people
224.article_body: A 44-year-old man named Chandrabose has been arrested from Chennai for cheating thousands of people by opening his own bank - Rural and Agricultural Farmer's Cooperative Bank. The bank had nine branches across Tamil Nadu and collected unauthorised deposits of ₹2 lakh to ₹7 lakh. Police have recovered documents, a luxury car, and ₹56.6 lakh in cash from the accused.

225.title: Maha CM orders reconstruction of Mumbai's Gokhale bridge at earliest
225.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday asked Western Railway officials to reconstruct Gopal Krishna Gokhale overbridge in Mumbai's Andheri at the earliest. He also directed BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal to ensure proper traffic management. This comes after the area witnessed traffic jams after the dilapidated bridge, which links Andheri East to Andheri West, was shut for traffic on Monday.

226.title: Wish him fruitful tenure ahead: PM to Justice Chandrachud on becoming CJI
226.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Justice DY Chandrachud for being sworn in as the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI). "Wishing him a fruitful tenure ahead," PM Modi tweeted. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also congratulated the new CJI. "May he successfully uphold the cause of law and justice in our society in the times to come," CM Kejriwal tweeted.

227.title: Gadkari apologises for bad road being built for ₹400 crore in MP, crowd applauds
227.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari put out a public apology for what he said was a poorly built stretch of highway in Madhya Pradesh. "Part of the road stretch- a two lane project from Barela to Mandla- is being built at ₹400 crore but I'm not satisfied with it," he said. Gadkari's apology was followed by applause from the crowd.

228.title: Ayushmann Khurrana unveils first look of his film 'An Action Hero'
228.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana shared the first look of his upcoming film 'An Action Hero', which is scheduled to hit the theatres on December 2 this year. The actor had previously called the "slick action and offbeat satire" film as "genre-breaker" for him. Directed by Anirudh Iyer, the film will be produced by Colour Yellow Productions and T-Series.

229.title: Rohit, Rahul bat in old-fashioned way, India need to be dynamic: Hussain
229.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul have batted in an "old fashioned" way during the first few overs in the T20 World Cup 2022. "India need to be more dynamic if they're going to win World Cups," added Hussain. "India have underperformed in...tournaments," he stated. India will face England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final.

230.title: Party that breaks country now doing Bharat Jodo Yatra: K'taka CM
230.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra, saying that the same party that breaks the country into pieces is now doing Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Congress Party's policy is to divide and rule," CM Bommai added. Rahul Gandhi concluded the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra last month.

231.title: Skye Air Mobility raises $1.7 mn in a round led by Chiratae Ventures
231.article_body: Drone delivery startup Skye Air Mobility has secured $1.7 million in seed round led by Chiratae Ventures. The funding round saw participation from investors like Lead Angels, O2 Angels, Agility Ventures and LetsVenture. Angel investors including Curefoods Founder Ankit Nagori and Mamaearth Co-founder Varun Alagh also participated. The firm was co-founded by Chandra Prakash and Swapnik Jakkampudi.

232.title: 58-yr-old man falls in pit dug for Worli-Sewri connector in Mumbai, dies
232.article_body: A 58-year-old man, Pradeep Dhondu Ambekar, died after falling into a 10-feet deep uncovered pit in Mumbai's Worli on Monday evening. Police said the pit was dug by a contractor engaged by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) for construction of Worli-Sewri connector flyover. "We are yet to register any offence...and will record statement of the family members," police said.

233.title: Tabu says Babita Kapoor used to call her & Karisma 'hit pair of cinema'
233.article_body: Actress Tabu recalled that Karisma Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor Khan's mother Babita Kapoor used to call her and Karisma the "hit pair of cinema". Tabu and Karisma have featured in 'Saajan Chale Sasural', 'Biwi No.1' and other films. Tabu's next film is 'The Crew', starring Kareena. "I'm certain I'll derive a lot of happiness and joy from...this film," she said.

234.title: Congress is guarantee of instability, corruption & scams: PM Modi
234.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi said that the Congress is the guarantee of instability, corruption and scams. "Congress can never give a stable govt to Himachal Pradesh and neither do they want," PM Modi said. "Congress has only two states left, Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh, no news of development comes from these two states," he added.

235.title: Hyd's Hussain Sagar Lake to get musical fountains ahead of Formula E race
235.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) will install musical floating fountains in Hussain Sagar Lake ahead of Formula E race. The fountains will be installed on NTR Marg roadside at an estimated cost of ₹17.02 crore. The HMDA is in the process of finding agencies for supply, installation and commissioning of fountains with operation and maintenance period of three years.

236.title: SRK gave me a career advice, I highly swear by it: Abhishek Bachchan
236.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan recalled an advice given by actor Shah Rukh Khan during his initial career days and added he "highly" swears by it. "[SRK said], 'Ask yourself....if whatever you're doing right now isn't your favourite, then why are you...doing it? Don't focus on what [will] happen in future...focus on your present...give your 100% to it'," Abhishek added.

237.title: 26-yr-old Hyd man hangs himself on live video call with lover
237.article_body: A Hyderabad man died by suicide after hanging himself from a ceiling fan while on a live video call with the girl he loved, after their families rejected their marriage. The deceased, 26-year-old Mohd Tabrez Ali, was in love with a woman from his neighbourhood for the last year. He made a video call to her before hanging himself.

238.title: Stones pelted at local train in Thane, 3 passengers injured
238.article_body: Three passengers were injured after unidentified persons pelted stones at a local train in Thane near Kalwa, Railway police said on Wednesday. The incident took place around 8 pm on Tuesday, after which the injured were taken to a hospital for treatment, an official said. A member of the railway advisory committee demanded increased surveillance and action against the culprits.

239.title: Centre could trim spending for the first time in 3 years: Report
239.article_body: The Union Government could spend less than budgeted for the first time in three years in the current fiscal, according to a report. The total expenditure for 2022-23 could be approximately ₹70,000 crore to ₹80,000 crore less than the budgeted ₹39.45 lakh crore. The government is reportedly keen to meet a fiscal deficit target of 6.4% of the GDP.

240.title: Mumbai's special court refuses ED's request to stay Sanjay Raut's bail
240.article_body: A special court in Mumbai refused the Enforcement Directorate's request to stay Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's bail on Wednesday. Raut was granted bail in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project earlier today. The court has also granted bail to his co-accused Pravin Raut and both of them will be released.

241.title: PCMC begins confiscating moveable assets of property tax defaulters
241.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) started confiscating moveable assets of residents who have dubious record of defaulting on property tax amounting to ₹1 lakh or more for years. According to a PCMC official, 8,791 residents owe PCMC ₹1 lakh or more in property tax dues. Some citizens have not paid their dues for more than seven years, the official added.

242.title: Priyanka Chopra praises CM Yogi's UP govt, says 'I saw a big change here'
242.article_body: UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador Priyanka Chopra has praised CM Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government for its responsible attitude towards women and improvement in their condition in the state. The actress, who'd reached Lucknow for a UNICEF programme, said, "I saw a big change here. In fact, UP needed this change." "Today, maximum number of girls are going...school in [UP]," she added.

243.title: Rare to be cast alongside women you admire: Kriti on 'The Crew'
243.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that it is rare to be cast in a film alongside "women you admire" in an industry where "male-dominated films rule the box office". The actress, who'll be seen in Rhea Kapoor's 'The Crew', said she was "thrilled" to be sharing screen space with Tabu and Kareena Kapoor Khan in the comedy-drama film.

244.title: Mondelēz halts ads on Twitter citing hate speech after Musk takeover
244.article_body: Oreo cookies maker Mondelēz International has halted ads on Twitter citing the increase in hate speech after Elon Musk's takeover of the social media platform. Mondelēz CEO Dirk Van de Put said, "What we've seen recently since the change on Twitter has been announced, is the amount of hate speech increase significantly...our advertising would appear next to the wrong messages."

245.title: Malaika celebrates son Arhaan's 20th b'day, calls him 'grown-up man'
245.article_body: Malaika Arora shared her son Arhaan Khan's unseen pictures on Instagram to wish him on his 20th birthday. "My baby boy is a grown up man today, but will always be my baby," she captioned the post, which received reactions from Malaika's friends, including Kareena Kapoor Khan. Malaika's sister Amrita Arora also wished Arhaan and called him her "constant".

246.title: Films never fail, its the budgets that fail: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai
246.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the failure of a film, said, "There's a saying in the film industry, 'Films never fail, its budget fails'. Budgets make the film fail." He added that understanding a film's budget is important as many films fail because of it. "If you make a film of ₹200 crore...your film collects....₹100 crore...it's a flop," he added.

247.title: Thief falls unconscious after running into glass window with stolen bags from US LV store
247.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was caught on video running into a glass window as he attempted to escape with goods stolen from a Louis Vuitton store in Seattle. According to the police, the 17-year-old suspect grabbed handbags worth $18,000 off displays. The video showed the teenager collapsing to the floor unconscious after hitting the glass window.

248.title: 22-yr-old woman pushed to death from 3rd floor by ex-boyfriend in Noida
248.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died after her ex-boyfriend pushed her from the third floor of an office building in Noida, police said. The incident occurred when the accused, who was also her colleague, was trying to force her into staying in his contact. He had fled with her body to Ghaziabad and was going towards Meerut when the police nabbed him.

249.title: Pune man booked under SC/ST Act for hurling casteist slurs at tenant
249.article_body: A real estate developer has been booked under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act for hurling casteist remarks at a tenant in Pune. According to the FIR, Malojirao Rangrao Kakade also threatened the complainant, Vijay Gaikwad, with dire consequences when he questioned about a rent agreement. Notably, Kakade had earlier accused Gaikwad of attempting to extort ₹2 lakh from him.

250.title: NZ allocates $12 million in climate funding for developing nations
250.article_body: New Zealand will allocate $12 million in climate funding to address loss and damage in developing countries. Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta said the country will work with its Pacific partners to support their priorities. Mahuta added that New Zealand recognises that loss and damage for Pacific countries take many forms like culture, language, mental health and physical wellbeing.

251.title: PM Modi stops convoy to let ambulance pass in Himachal Pradesh, video goes viral
251.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who was in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday for election campaign, stopped his convoy for an ambulance to pass in Chambi. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media. The video showed the ambulance speeding by as PM Modi and his convoy waited for it to pass and then made their way ahead.

252.title: Lotus is 'aasan' of Maa Lakshmi: BJP on Cong’s criticism of G20 logo
252.article_body: Responding to Congress' criticism of India's logo for the presidency of the G20, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla on Wednesday said that the lotus is the country's national flower. He also said that Goddess Lakshmi is also seated on a lotus. "Rajiv (Gandhi) also means Kamal. Hope you see no agenda there," Poonawalla said.

253.title: Which are Asia's best universities according to the latest QS rankings?
253.article_body: China's Peking University topped the QS Asia University Rankings 2023 with an overall score of 100. It dethroned last year's number-one university, the National University of Singapore, which took the second spot this year. Nineteen Indian institutes and universities feature among the top 200 in Asia, with IIT Bombay ranked the best in India.

254.title: Serving people is my priority: Justice Chandrachud after taking oath as CJI
254.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud, who was sworn in as the 50th CJI on Wednesday, said his first priority would be to serve the common man and bring in reforms in the Supreme Court registry. President Droupadi Murmu administered the oath of office to the new CJI at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Justice Chandrachud will serve as the CJI for two years.

255.title: Ex-MP CM Nath who burnt Sikhs was honoured on Guru Nanak Jayanti: Sikh singer
255.article_body: A video of singer Manpreet Singh Kanpuri, criticising the decision to honour former MP CM Kamal Nath on the occasion of Guru Nanak Jayanti in Indore, has gone viral. In the video, Kanpuri said that a person "who burnt Sikhs by putting tyres around their neck" was called to the event, adding, "Guru Nanak is watching."

256.title: Malaika & I have learned to accept each other's choices: Arbaaz Khan
256.article_body: Actor Arbaaz Khan, speaking about his ex-wife Malaika Arora, has said, "She's been mature about a lot of things and fortunately, I have been as well." He added that they both have learned to accept each other's choices. "We have one common interest...that's our child...he doesn't deserve...any kind of scenario where there's a discord while he's growing up," he added.

257.title: Kalpataru, Dynamix & NL Dalmia jointly launch a luxury tower in Mira Rd
257.article_body: Kalpataru Group, along with Dynamix & NL Dalmia, stated that they have redefined Mumbai's Mira Road's market with Srishti township since 1985. Seeking to set a new benchmark with Srishti Namaah, the group announced the launch of a luxury tower of spacious homes with lavish decks, 180° views & 40+ world-class amenities, which is 5 minutes from Western Express Highway.

258.title: Salesforce confirms laying off hundreds of employees
258.article_body: Enterprise software firm Salesforce has laid off hundreds of employees on "accountability" issues. Several others are also likely to be put on a 30-day review, with the aim to let them go after a month. "Our sales performance process drives accountability. Unfortunately, that can lead to some leaving the business, and we support them through their transition." Salesforce stated.

259.title: Worried about Rohit, he's just hanging the bat outside off-stump: Hogg
259.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said he is "worried" about Rohit Sharma, who has scored 89 runs in the T20 World Cup 2022 so far. "He has got too much on his plate...I don't think I have seen...solid footwork...[since he became Team India's captain]...He is just hanging the bat outside off-stump and hoping that he finds the middle," added Hogg.

260.title: Cognizant says it fired 6% employees in Q2 due to failed background checks
260.article_body: Cognizant India has revealed that they had a 6% involuntary attrition in the quarter ended September. The company's India head Rajesh Nambiar said the high involuntary attrition was due to failed background checks. "They don't have the right background to continue in that role. We have no tolerance for anyone who doesn't clear background checks," he mentioned.

261.title: India to become world's third-largest economy by 2027: Morgan Stanley
261.article_body: India is on a path to surpass Japan and Germany to become the world's third-largest economy by 2027, according to a Morgan Stanley report. The report said India's GDP could more than double from $3.5 trillion today to surpass $7.5 trillion by 2031. The BSE could reach a market capitalisation of $10 trillion in the coming decade, the report said.

262.title: Don't make not having Twitter blue tick the new cool: Nikhil Kamath to Musk
262.article_body: Zerodha Co-Founder Nikhil Kamath spoke against Elon Musk offering verification badges on Twitter for $8 monthly subscription saying, "When you make exclusivity publicly accessible, it's no longer exclusivity." Tagging Musk, he added, "Elon Musk, don't make not having a verified badge the new cool (for Twitter's sake)." The subscription has been rolled out in US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

263.title: Insurtech platform Plum lays off 36 employees
263.article_body: Sequoia and Tiger Global-backed insurtech platform Plum has laid off 36 employees owing to tough market conditions in the startup ecosystem, Co-Founders Abhishek Poddar and Saurabh Arora said. The laid off staff will be given support such as severance pay, healthcare benefits, well-being counselling and Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), they added. Plum raised $15.6 million in May 2021.

264.title: 5 undertrials booked following clashes at Yerawada Central Prison in Pune
264.article_body: Five undertrials lodged at Pune's Yerawada Central Prison were booked on the charges of unlawful assembly, assault and rioting after clashes broke out inside the prison on Tuesday. The clashes led to stone pelting among inmates and assault on prison employees. The incident occurred in barrack numbers 27 and 31 and near the prison infirmary, Yerawada police station officials said.

265.title: Kejriwal's govt collected ₹1,286 cr as green cess, utilised nothing: BJP's Lekhi
265.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi criticised the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in Delhi alleging that his government has collected ₹1,286 crore from people as Environment Cess and it has not been utilised for improving the condition. She further accused AAP government of showing sheer negligence and said, "Delhi needs a full-time CM. This part-time CM has shown no concern for Delhi."

266.title: Man robs, rapes Noida woman after meeting her on 'Jeevansathi.com'; held
266.article_body: Noida Police on Tuesday said that they had arrested a Ghaziabad man for cheating a woman of ₹30 lakh and raping her after befriending her on 'Jeevansathi.com'. The accused posed as a senior officer at Airtel and took ₹30 lakh from the woman, saying that his sister was suffering from cancer, said Additional DCP (Noida) Ashutosh Dwivedi.

267.title: BMC to close SV Road bridge in Malad, sends notices to vacate shops
267.article_body: After declaring SV Road bridge in Malad dilapidated in 2019, BMC has now sent notices to the shopowners sitting on the alignment of the bridge to vacate their shops. The corporation had completed tendering for its reconstruction but the construction could not be started as the shopowners refused to shift, an official said. They are reportedly unhappy with the compensation.

268.title: Eureka Forbes announces new chief product and technology officer, CFO
268.article_body: Eureka Forbes (EFL) said it has appointed Shubham Srivastava as the Chief Product and Technology Officer and Gaurav Khandelwal as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). The company said Srivastava will drive digital transformation, while Khandelwal will lead the finance, commercial, legal and secretarial functions. Khandelwal has earlier worked with companies like Hindustan Unilever, Airtel and Oyo.

269.title: Measles outbreak confirmed in Mumbai slum after 3 kids die
269.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has confirmed the outbreak of measles in Govandi's Rafi Nagar slum, which lies in the M/East ward in Mumbai. This comes after three children aged between one and five died in the area after developing rashes and fever. A BMC official said six cases of the contagious disease have been confirmed in Rafi Nagar.

270.title: N Korea fired ballistic missile towards eastern sea: S Korea
270.article_body: North Korea fired a short-range ballistic missile towards its eastern sea from Sukchon, Seoul’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said. Last week, North Korea launched missiles in response to joint drills conducted by South Korea and the US. South Korea’s military said it recovered debris of one of the North Korean missiles determined to be a Soviet-era anti-aircraft weapon.

271.title: Pune girl declared brain-dead after accident, family donates her organs
271.article_body: The parents of a 10-year-old girl donated her organs and saved three persons' lives when she was declared brain-dead after a road accident in Pune. Her heart was donated to a one-year-old girl in Mumbai, while her kidney and liver were donated to a 37-year-old woman and seven-year-old girl, respectively. The girl was hit by a speeding moped in October.

272.title: I was very scared when I posted it: Samantha on revealing about myositis diagnosis
272.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently posted a picture showing IV drips attached to her as she dubbed for 'Yashoda' and revealed she was diagnosed with an autoimmune condition, myositis. She said, "I was very scared when I posted it. I was already weak and vulnerable, and I didn't know if I'd enough strength to take if somebody said a wrong thing."

273.title: Man weighing 153 kg granted bail, court says 'obesity is root cause of other diseases'
273.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to a money laundering accused, noting that he's an 'obese' person who weighs 153 kg. Considering his co-morbidities, it can be said that he falls in the exception of being "sick", the court noted. It took note of doctors' opinion and said obesity is the "root cause of several other diseases".

274.title: China factory prices drop for 1st time in 2 years amid COVID-19 curbs
274.article_body: China's factory gate prices or producer price index (PPI) fell by 1.3% year-on-year for October, its first decline since December 2020, the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data showed on Wednesday. This was driven by faltering domestic demand amid COVID-19 curbs, a property slump and global recession risk hitting the economy. Consumer inflation moderated from a 29-month high in September.

275.title: 16-yr-old B'luru student dies by suicide after being caught cheating
275.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Bengaluru died after he allegedly jumped from the 14th floor of an apartment building on Tuesday, hours after he was caught cheating during a test. According to reports, some residents tried dissuading him from taking the extreme step when he went to the apartment building where his friend lived after sneaking out of his school.

276.title: Kerala govt to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as universities' Chancellor
276.article_body: Kerala government on Wednesday decided to bring in an ordinance to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as the Chancellor of state-run universities. The government is planning to appoint an expert from the education sector for the Chancellor's post. The decision came following several arguments between Khan and the state government in recent months over the administration of universities.

277.title: What is wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands: Sunil Gavaskar
277.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that fake fielding should be considered as part of the deception that the game of cricket has. Gavaskar said that bowlers and batters try to deceive each other using various measures, adding, "Then what's wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands when he actually doesn't have it."

278.title: Leave Twitter before it's too late: Actor Mark Ruffalo to Elon Musk
278.article_body: Actor Mark Ruffalo once again called out Elon Musk for his policies at Twitter and tweeted, "Leave Twitter before it's too late…never mind. It's too late. Billionaire Hubris syndrome." Ruffalo also criticised Musk for breaking his promise to keep Twitter "politically neutral" and recommending voting for Republicans. "He (Musk) speaks with a forked tongue," tweeted Ruffalo.

279.title: Twitter's top exec Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers
279.article_body: Twitter's Head of Safety and Integrity Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers and joined Twitter in 2015. While Roth has become the public face of Twitter's content moderation since Elon Musk took over, the latter also suggested people follow Roth’s Twitter feed for an "accurate" understanding of what’s happening with trust and safety at Twitter.

280.title: Robbers push passenger out of moving train in Bihar; 2nd incident in 4 days
280.article_body: A 34-year-old man, travelling in Tatanagar link Express, was pushed out of a moving train by armed robbers on Tuesday night between Barauni-Khagaria rail sections of Samastipur rail division, the police said. The victim was standing near the gate to de-board the train at Barauni when the incident happened. A similar incident occurred in Katihar-Barauni sections on November 5.

281.title: Sanjay, Sunny, Jackie and Mithun's 1st look from 'Baap' revealed; people say '80s are back'
281.article_body: The first look of Sanjay Dutt, Sunny Deol, Jackie Shroff and Mithun Chakraborty from the movie 'Baap' has been revealed. Reacting to the picture, social media users wrote, "I am loving the whole 80s action star vibes in this poster," and, "Dammmnnn the 90s me is getting legit excited." "This is going to be legendary," another user wrote.

282.title: 24-yr-old woman gets man arrested for molesting her twice in Mumbai Metro
282.article_body: A 24-year-old woman, with the help of another passenger, got a 29-year-old man arrested for molesting her twice inside the Mumbai Metro while she was on her way to work, police said. The accused bumped into the victim once, officials said, adding that he later stood behind the woman in the metro and sexually abused her.

283.title: Threw up every time SRK removed his shirt in 'Dard-E-Disco': Farah
283.article_body: Director-choreographer Farah Khan shared that during the filming of Om Shanti Om's 'Dard-E-Disco' song, she'd "throw up every time" Shah Rukh Khan would remove his shirt. She remembered that it was the first time when Shah Rukh showcased his six-pack abs on screen. Farah added that people said the film wouldn't work, but she was very sure about it.

284.title: He told me 'You've screwed us the most': Referee on sending Pique off
284.article_body: Discussing his decision to show a red card to Barcelona defender Gerard Pique in his final appearance for the club against Osasuna, referee Gil Manzano said, "Pique told me, 'You're the referee who's screwed us the most'." "Pique continued to repeat the same expressions...He said, 'It's a f***ing shame'," added Manzano. Pique was sent off from the bench at half-time.

285.title: Driffle raises $3.4 million in seed funding round led by BEENEXT
285.article_body: Digital gaming marketplace Driffle has secured $3.4 million in a seed round led by venture capital firm BEENEXT. Other investors including JAFCO Asia, Taurus Ventures, Better Capital and White Venture Capital raised funds. The funding round also saw participation from Cred Founder Kunal Shah, Global Chief Strategy Officer at OYO Maninder Gulati, StayVista Co-founder Amit Damani among others.

286.title: Bitcoin briefly falls to its lowest since Nov 2020 amid Binance-FTX deal
286.article_body: Bitcoin fell to $17,300.80 on Tuesday, the lowest level since November 2020, triggered by reports of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance taking over its rival FTX. Bitcoin rose by 6% initially following the takeover announcement but then fell as investors were worried about FTX’s balance sheet. Bitcoin was trading over 7% lower at $18,372.07 around 11.55 am on Wednesday, Coinbase showed.

287.title: Sanjay Raut gets bail in Patra Chawl money laundering case
287.article_body: A Mumbai court on Wednesday granted bail to Shiv Sena leader and MP Sanjay Raut in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project. The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Raut in July this year for his alleged role in financial irregularities in connection with the redevelopment of the Patra Chawl.

288.title: England have 65% chance of winning T20 WC semi-final vs India: Afridi
288.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said England have a 60-65 per cent chance of winning their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against India. "I feel England's combination is extremely good," added Afridi. Former England captain Kevin Pietersen had earlier stated that he "really" thinks England will beat India in the semi-final, which is set to take place on November 10 (Thursday).

289.title: No effective climate policy without peace: Ukrainian President at COP27
289.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that there can be no effective climate policy without peace. In a video message played at the COP27 climate conference in Egypt, Zelenskyy highlighted the impact of the war on global energy supplies and food prices. "The Russian war destroyed five million acres of forests in Ukraine in less than six months," he added.

290.title: Next level fraudsters, says Paytm CEO while sharing scam text pic; Twitter users react
290.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma shared a screenshot of a fraudulent message he received that read 'Dr Larry Greens' from the USA is looking for a partner in India to supply raw materials. Sharma tweeted, "Next level fraudsters." Commenting on his post, some Twitter users shared screenshots of similar messages while one wrote, "Still some people will believe in India."

291.title: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia tests positive for COVID-19
291.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus. In a tweet, Scindia informed that he got tested for COVID-19 on the advice of doctors and the report has come positive. He has asked everyone who came in contact with him in the last few days to get themselves tested.

292.title: 'Har Har Mahadev' doesn't disrespect Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj: Makers
292.article_body: The makers of 'Har Har Mahadev' have released a statement to clarify that the film doesn't disrespect Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "There's no intention or attempt to distort anyone's image or our glorious history," the statement read. The makers also condemned Nationalist Congress Party leader Jitendra Awhad's recent "act of attacking filmgoers" and said they trust the law and order system.

293.title: French firm PhotoRoom raises $19 mn in round led by Balderton Capital
293.article_body: France-based photo editing startup PhotoRoom has secured $19 million in Series A funding round led by Balderton Capital. Angel investors from Facebook, Hugging Face and Disney+ also participated in the funding round. The company was founded by Matthieu Rouif and Eliot Andres. PhotoRoom plans to use funds to develop its software, improve AI features and increase workforce in Europe.

294.title: If AAP wins MCD polls, garbage mountains in Delhi will disappear in 5 yrs: Dy CM
294.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said people will vote for "jhaadu" in MCD elections to "clear garbage" of BJP. "If AAP comes to power in MCD, all mountains of garbage in Delhi will disappear in five years," Sisodia said after visiting Ghazipur landfill site. "CM...Kejriwal has made plan to remove mountains of garbage, trash from Delhi," he stated.

295.title: Minor arrested under POCSO Act for raping 13-yr-old girl in Hyd
295.article_body: A teenager and a 21-year-old man allegedly raped a schoolgirl in Hyderabad. The accused Rathan Lal and his teenage friend, who are the neighbours of the victim, took her on a joyride and after returning, both the accused raped the girl on terrace of Rathan's house. Police nabbed the teenager under POCSO Act and are searching for the prime accused.

296.title: Pics of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport T2 go viral before inauguration
296.article_body: Photos showing the new Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru have gone viral. The terminal, built at a cost of around ₹5,000 crore, will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on November 11. The terminal is designed as a tribute to the garden city of Bengaluru and the experience is meant to be a "walk in the garden".

297.title: Aruna Miller becomes 1st Indian-American Lieutenant Governor of US' Maryland
297.article_body: Aruna Miller on Tuesday scripted history by becoming the first Indian-American politician to win the race of Lieutenant Governor in the state of Maryland, US. "Maryland, you chose unity over division, expanding rights over restricting rights, and hope over fear," Miller said. She was born in Andhra Pradesh before migrating to the US along with her parents.

298.title: Pakistan, New Zealand announce their playing XIs for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final
298.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bat first in the first semi-final of T20 World Cup 2022 against Pakistan. Both New Zealand and Pakistan are fielding unchanged playing XIs. Pakistan have won 17 of the 28 T20Is played between the two sides. The match is taking place at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

299.title: He looked like typical star kid: Imtiaz Ali on Ranbir's first impression
299.article_body: Director Imtiaz Ali said when he saw Ranbir Kapoor as a kid, he looked like a "typical star kid, wearing formal clothes". "He had floppily straight hair and was looking very nervous and embarrassed," he recalled. Imtiaz said as an actor, Ranbir had a difficult journey in Bollywood, but he lived up to people's expectations.

300.title: Over 64,000 people die of snake bites in India per year, highest globally: Study
300.article_body: India accounts for almost 80% of global snake bite deaths, with over 64,000 people dying every year, according to a recent study conducted by a group of researchers from 22 countries. According to the study, UP, followed by MP and Rajasthan, reported highest number of deaths due to snake bites. Actual numbers are likely higher, snake bite treatment experts claimed.

301.title: What is the head-to-head record of Pakistan and New Zealand in T20I cricket?
301.article_body: Pakistan and New Zealand, who will face each other in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final today, have played 28 T20Is against each other so far. Pakistan have won 17 matches, while New Zealand have won 11. In T20 World Cup history, Pakistan and New Zealand have faced each other six times, with Pakistan winning four times.

302.title: Russia is not reliable: US after Jaishankar says 'India will keep buying Russian oil'
302.article_body: A day after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that buying Russian oil worked to India's advantage and that it'll continue doing that, US State Department Spokesperson Ned Price said Russia isn't a reliable source of energy. Price added, "It isn't in the interest of the region or Ukraine but the collective interest for which India should decrease its dependence."

303.title: 'Major polluter' India must pay for climate damage: Island nations at climate summit
303.article_body: During the climate summit in Egypt, the Alliance of Small Island States said highly polluting emerging economies including India and China should pay into a climate compensation fund to help countries rebuild after climate change-driven disasters. The association described India and China as "major polluters". India's per capita emissions are significantly lower than world average.

304.title: 22-yr-old man arrested for social media post against Manipur CM & BJP
304.article_body: A 22-year-old man, Laishram Malemnganba, was arrested on Monday in Manipur for allegedly making derogatory remarks against CM N Biren Singh and BJP on Facebook, police said. Malemnganba was arrested from his house in Waiton in Imphal East district on the basis of a complaint lodged by state BJYM chief Manoharmayum Barish Sharma, police added.

305.title: Latest all-time T20I batting rankings released by ICC, 3 Indians in top 10
305.article_body: The ICC has released the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav jumping to eighth position with 869 rating points. Virat Kohli (third with 897 rating points) and KL Rahul (tenth with 854 rating points) are the other two Indians to feature in the top 10. The all-time rankings are led by Dawid Malan, with 915 rating points.

306.title: Was doubted for choosing Deepika for 'Love Aaj Kal': Imtiaz Ali
306.article_body: Director Imtiaz Ali revealed that people doubted his decision to cast Deepika Padukone in 'Love Aaj Kal' as they didn't think she was a good actress. "She was supposed to be beautiful, not a good actor. She has changed that over the years," Imtiaz said. The director said both Deepika and Ranbir Kapoor enjoy acting and "really enjoy working together".

307.title: We'll do everything to ensure India-Pak final doesn't happen: Buttler
307.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said his team will "do everything" they can to ensure that the T20 World Cup 2022 final doesn't witness a match between India and Pakistan. "India are a very, very strong team...There are fantastic players in their lineup," added Buttler. India will take on England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final on Thursday.

308.title: FIR ordered against 'The Kerala Story' for showing state as ISIS terrorists' haven
308.article_body: Kerala DGP Anil Kant has directed to register an FIR against the crew of film 'The Kerala Story' for allegedly portraying the state as a safe haven of terrorists. The teaser of the movie claimed that over 32,000 Kerala women were converted and most of them were taken to Islamic State-held areas in Syria and Afghanistan in the last decade.

309.title: Democrat Wes Moore becomes 1st black Governor of US state of Maryland
309.article_body: Democrat Wes Moore has been elected as the first black Governor of the US state of Maryland. Moore defeated Republican Dan Cox, a first-term state legislator, who was endorsed by former President Donald Trump. Virginia's Douglas Wilder in 1989 and Deval Patrick of Massachusetts in 2006 were the only two black politicians to be elected Governor in the US.

310.title: India have been begging for more from Pant, he could surprise vs Eng: Lee
310.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said India have been "begging for more" from Rishabh Pant, adding that he could spring a "surprise" with his performance in India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England. "Pant could be very, very dangerous...He might just be given that...license to go out and dominate [at] the top of the order," added Lee.

311.title: Tesla recalls over 40,000 cars facing power steering issues in US
311.article_body: Tesla is recalling over 40,000 2017-2021 Model S and Model X vehicles in US that may experience a loss of power steering assist when being driven on rough roads or after hitting a pothole. The recall requires an over-the-air software update. The Elon Musk-led automaker said as of November 1, 97% of the recalled vehicles have installed the new update.

312.title: India reports 811 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 13,559
312.article_body: India reported 811 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 625 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases in India went down to 13,559 from the earlier 14,021. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,511, according to the ministry.

313.title: Mumbai local train services hit due to signal failure
313.article_body: Mumbai local train services were hit after a signal failure was reported between Andheri and Jogeshwari stations on Wednesday. The snag was reported on Up and Down fast line of Western Railway at around 9.12 am but trains were running behind the schedule due to cascading effect, railway officials said. The trains are reportedly delayed by at least 20 minutes.

314.title: Wanindu Hasaranga becomes world number one T20I bowler, no Indian in top 10
314.article_body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga has become the world number one T20I bowler, as per the latest rankings. Hasaranga, who is the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 so far with 15 scalps, overtook Afghanistan's Rashid Khan in rankings. The 25-year-old is on top of rankings with 704 rating points. There is no Indian bowler in the top 10.

315.title: Thought Tabu hated The Crew's script, was elated when she said yes: Rhea
315.article_body: Producer Rhea Kapoor said that she thought Tabu "hated" the script of 'The Crew' as the actress didn't respond after the film's narration. She shared that when Tabu agreed to be on-board, she felt "super elated". She revealed that Kareena Kapoor Khan was "the first person" to be cast. "There is nobody else who can play this role," Rhea added.

316.title: Sherlyn Chopra 'producing filth', she is a menace to society: Raj Kundra
316.article_body: Calling actress-model Sherlyn Chopra a "menace to society", Raj Kundra said, "Who is she blaming for her own produced X rate content on OnlyFans that she has monetised...She will be arrested soon...matter of time." In October last year, Sherlyn had filed a complaint against Kundra and his wife, actress Shilpa Shetty, for fraud and mental harassment.

317.title: Bicycle rally organised in Pune to create voter awareness
317.article_body: A bicycle rally was flagged off by Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar in Pune on Wednesday to create awareness about voter registration as part of the national-level launch of a special summary revision of the voters' list. "The summary revision takes place every year...This year we are...starting it all over the country from Pune today," Kumar said.

318.title: Indigo Paints' stock falls by 6% after reports of ₹283-cr block deal
318.article_body: Shares of Indigo Paints dropped by 6% in Wednesday's early trade after 21 lakh shares, representing 4.4% equity, reportedly changed hands at ₹1,384 per unit. The transaction is valued at ₹283 crore. At 11:07 am, Indigo Paints' stock was trading 5.20% down at ₹1,414.90 apiece on the National Stock Exchange. The stock's 52-week low is ₹1,331 apiece.

319.title: Berkshire becomes 5th-biggest firm in S&P 500 Index after Tesla's $360-bn loss
319.article_body: After Elon Musk-led Tesla's stock lost $360 billion on Tuesday and closed with a market valuation of $604 billion, Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway replaced the electric-vehicle maker as the fifth-biggest company in the S&P 500 Index. Berkshire's market valuation is nearly $645 billion. Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet and Amazon.com are the four biggest firms in the S&P 500 Index, respectively.

320.title: Pune police bust prostitution racket at spa, 2 women rescued
320.article_body: Pune City Police's Crime Branch busted a prostitution racket running under the garb of a spa and massage centre in Warje-Malwadi area. Police rescued two women and arrested the 25-year-old manager of the spa. A search has been launched for the owner. The women who have been rescued are from Maharashtra and were allegedly forced into prostitution, officials said.

321.title: Sack Tamil Nadu Governor, he has been instigating communal hatred: DMK to President
321.article_body: The DMK has said the party-led Secular Progressive Alliance has petitioned President Droupadi Murmu to sack Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi. Their memorandum said, "RN Ravi has violated the oath he took under Article 159 to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution...Far from it, he has been instigating communal hatred and is a threat to the peace of the state."

322.title: Feels like power move: Jennifer on why Ben shouldn't be called Mr Lopez
322.article_body: Singer-actress Jennifer Lopez said that her legal name will be Mrs Affleck but she doesn't want her husband Ben Affleck to be called Mr Lopez. "It's not traditional. It doesn't have any romance to it. It feels like it's a power move," she said. Lopez also spoke about Ben's ex-wife Jennifer Garner and called her "an amazing co-parent".

323.title: I'd love to buy Liverpool: Conor McGregor despite being Man Utd fan
323.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight champion Conor McGregor took to Twitter to express his desire to buy Premier League club Liverpool, tweeting he'd "love" to buy the club despite being a fan of arch-rivals Manchester United. "I requested...information...[as] soon as I heard [about Liverpool being up for sale]," added McGregor. "I was attracted to the success...of Manchester United," he had earlier stated.

324.title: Maharashtra to have one sub-inspector post reserved for transgender
324.article_body: The Mumbai bench of the Maharashtra Administrative Tribunal (MAT) has directed the state government to reserve one post of sub-inspector for transgender persons in this year's selection process. MAT chairperson issued the order on Monday, saying that it was bound by the Supreme Court's 2014 judgment asking all state governments to have a reservation for transgenders for all public appointments.

325.title: IMA backs H’yana MBBS students protesting bond fee, condemns police action
325.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) extended its support to MBBS students in Haryana protesting state government's bond policy that mandated them to pay a bond fee of around ₹10 lakh during admission. IMA also condemned alleged police action against the students. "Students became a victim of barbaric police action...We request Haryana CM...that bond system be scrapped/modified," IMA said.

326.title: What will happen if India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England gets abandoned?
326.article_body: India will face England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final in Adelaide on Thursday. In case, rain doesn't allow the match to be completed on Thursday, it'll continue on reserve day on Friday. If weather conditions lead to abandonment, India will reach final as they finished first in their Super 12 group, while England finished second in their group.

327.title: Pique denied final Barcelona appearance after getting sent off from bench at half-time
327.article_body: Barcelona defender Gerard Pique was denied the chance to make a final appearance for his club after getting sent off from bench at half time against Osasuna in a La Liga match. Pique was shown a red card after remonstrating with match officials. Pique was reportedly protesting against Robert Lewandowski being sent off earlier in the match.

328.title: US state of Maryland legalises marijuana, 4 other states vote
328.article_body: Voters in the US state of Maryland have approved legalisation of recreational marijuana, becoming 20th state to do so. Adults over 21 years of age will be allowed to possess up to 1.5 ounces of marijuana and will be permitted to grow two plants away from public view. Arkansas, Missouri, North Dakota and South Dakota are voting on the same.

329.title: India should be worried about facing Eng who are a better team: Vaughan
329.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Team India should be "worried" about facing England in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two teams, adding that England are a "better white-ball team". "95 per cent...[of the crowd will support India] and England generally love [such an] atmosphere," he stated. "India...do not bat aggressively enough early on," said Vaughan.

330.title: Five Star Business Finance's ₹1,960-crore IPO opens today
330.article_body: The IPO of Five Star Business Finance, which provides small business loans and mortgage loans to micro-entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals, opened on Wednesday and the subscription will close on Friday. The price band of the issue has been fixed at ₹450 to ₹474/equity share. It is an offer for sale of 4.1 crore shares aggregating to ₹1,960 crore.

331.title: Media needs to be vigilant, flag govt’s shortcomings: Manmohan Singh
331.article_body: The media needs to remain vigilant and flag shortcomings of the government with a view to improve the effectiveness of governance, ex-PM Manmohan Singh said on Tuesday. On the role of the media in a democracy, Singh said it has a very important contribution to make in the process of nation-building. He was speaking at the TIOL Heritage Award function.

332.title: Amitabh Bachchan says he used to fast on Karwa Chauth for Jaya Bachchan
332.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan revealed that he used to keep Karwa Chauth fast for his wife and actress Jaya Bachchan. In a conversation with a contestant on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Big B said, "Shuru shuru me hum bhi rakhte the, fir chhod diye (I also used to fast initially, but then I stopped)." Amitabh and Jaya got married in 1973.

333.title: Why should I ignore hurtful comments: Sanjana on her 'chappal jaisi shakal' reply to troll
333.article_body: Sanjana Ganesan, who told a troll he has a "chappal-like face", wrote, "He instantly [deleted] the comment, [reported] my comment and [turned] his profile private." "If you're a troll and can't take one single negative comment...why am I expected to ignore...hurtful comments?" she added. The troll had commented, "You aren't beautiful enough for Jasprit Bumrah" on her post.

334.title: Anupam says Kirron Kher's 'cancer is in remission', calls her 'fighter'
334.article_body: Anupam Kher said Kirron Kher's recovery from cancer was the "biggest relief" and mentioned that her cancer "is in remission". Kirron was diagnosed with multiple myeloma in 2021. "She's a fighter...Giving up is not an option. Because you're known, you become a role model for people," he added. He shared that Kirron was "lucky to have wonderful doctors" in Mumbai.

335.title: Take criticism of collegium in positive light: Justice Chandrachud
335.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud said criticism of the collegium system must be looked at in a "positive light" and attempts made to improve it. "While we work within the fold of that system…yet at the same time, there are several improvements which we can bring about because no institution in any constitutional democracy can lay claim to be perfect," he added.

336.title: Justice DY Chandrachud takes oath as the 50th Chief Justice of India
336.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday administered the oath of office to the new Chief Justice of India, Justice DY Chandrachud, at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Justice DY Chandrachud is the 50th Chief Justice of India, succeeding Justice Uday Umesh Lalit. Justice Chandrachud will serve as the CJI for two years till November 10, 2024.

337.title: doola raises $8 mn in funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners
337.article_body: Fintech company doola, earlier known as StartPack, has raised $8 million in a funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners. It saw the participation of the Y Combinator Continuity Fund, among others. Arjun Mahadevan and JP Pincheira founded the startup in 2020 with its headquarters in New York City. doola helps its customers incorporate and access the US payment systems.

338.title: 1-on-1 mentorship is key to securing top tech roles: Scaler
338.article_body: Scaler shared that its learners prepare for in-demand tech roles by interacting one-on-one with seasoned tech professionals who help them set goals, understand complex concepts, get feedback, and stay motivated. Having worked at top tech companies, mentors share valuable insights from the industry that gives learners the extra edge to create a solid impact in their tech career, it added.

339.title: World's richest man Musk's net worth falls below $200 bn as Tesla shares decline
339.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk’s net worth dropped below $200 billion after Tesla shares hit a 52-week low on Tuesday. According to Forbes, this is only the second time since October 1, 2021, that Musk has been worth less than $200 billion. Tesla has seen its value fall by 14% since Musk completed the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter.

340.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with 329 AQI; Noida's AQI at 269
340.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 329, as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). Meanwhile, the air quality in Gautam Buddha Nagar was recorded in the 'poor' category with an AQI of 269 at around 9 am.

341.title: Maura Healey becomes 1st openly lesbian governor in US history
341.article_body: Maura Healey made history by becoming the first woman to be elected governor of Massachusetts and the first openly lesbian governor in US history. Healey, who was previously a civil rights lawyer, won the race against Republican Geoff Diehl. Jane Swift was first woman to fill Massachusetts Governor office in 2001, but she was appointed to the role, not elected.

342.title: Dropping Karthik for NZ tour during T20 WC 2022 wasn't right: Kaif
342.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said "dropping" Dinesh Karthik for India's tour of New Zealand during T20 World Cup 2022 wasn't right. "It affects the player...He feels the pressure. This...[has been] clearly seen in Karthik's case...The road ahead seems very difficult for Karthik," added Kaif. "Only Rishabh Pant will play now, irrespective of whether he does well or not," he stated.

343.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.3 hits Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh
343.article_body: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake occurred in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh at around 6.27 am on Wednesday. The depth of the earthquake was 5 km below the ground, the National Center for Seismology stated. This comes after Nepal was struck with an earthquake of 6.3-magnitude at around 2 am on Wednesday. The tremors were also felt across parts of Delhi-NCR.

344.title: Feel like a proud parent: Farah on 15 years of Deepika in Bollywood
344.article_body: Choreographer-director Farah Khan said she feels "like a proud parent" about actress Deepika Padukone, who completed 15 years in Bollywood today. "Whenever I go abroad and see people recognising her, I feel so proud...she has evolved and matured so much over the years," Farah said. Deepika made her Bollywood debut with Farah's 'Om Shanti Om', which released in 2007.

345.title: Pet-care startup Supertails raises $10 million in Series A funding
345.article_body: Tech-enabled pet-care startup Supertails raised $10 million in Series A round led by ﻿Fireside Ventures﻿, alongside existing investors ﻿Saama Capital﻿ and ﻿DSG Consumer Partners﻿. Other angel investors such as CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Genesis Luxury Fashion Founder and President Sanjay Kapoor, Mamaearth Co-founder and CEO Varun Alagh, among others also participated in the round.

346.title: Twitter to introduce 'Official' label for some verified accounts on launch of $8 plan
346.article_body: Twitter will introduce an "Official" label for selected verified accounts when it launches the $8 blue tick subscription service, said Twitter executive Esther Crawford. She added that not all previously verified accounts will get the "Official" label and that the label isn't available for purchase. Accounts that will receive it include government accounts, media outlets and some public figures.

347.title: 'The Crew' is my most fun & glamourous project yet: Rhea Kapoor
347.article_body: Filmmaker Rhea Kapoor called 'The Crew' her "most fun and glamorous project", starring Kareena Kapoor Khan, Kriti Sanon and Tabu.
