The film will be co-produced by Ekta Kapoor, who tagged Rhea as a filmmaker who "knows what she wants". "Rhea has a new, fresh, loud and clear voice...(in her) I found a creator I loved to align with," Ekta said.

348.title: My agent told Sir Alex not even a dog would sign deal he offered: Pogba
348.article_body: Discussing the contract he was offered by Manchester United's ex-manager Sir Alex Ferguson at 18, midfielder Paul Pogba said, "[My former agent] Mino Raiola told him that not even a dog would've [signed] it." "We stormed off, leaving him stunned," added Pogba. "Sir Alex arrived a little late [for] the meeting...We were waiting for him," he stated.

349.title: In pics: Last total lunar eclipse of 2022 from around the world
349.article_body: The world witnessed the last lunar eclipse of this year on Tuesday. It was the last total eclipse for the next three years because the next time this phenomenon will occur in March 2025. This gallery contains images of the eclipse from Mexico, El Salvador, China, Australia, Venezuela, Japan, Guatemala, and the last two photos are from Ranchi and Delhi.

350.title: BBMP chief sets November 15 deadline for filling potholes in B'luru
350.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has set November 15 as the deadline to fill potholes within the municipal limits. Before this, the deadline was November 10. "Around 800-1,000 potholes are filled every day," Nath told the media on Tuesday. "Around 6,000-6,500 potholes are yet to be filled," a BBMP official said.

351.title: 6 killed as house collapses after 6.6-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
351.article_body: Six people were killed after a house collapsed following an earthquake in Nepal. Nepal's seismological centre set the earthquake at a magnitude of 6.6, however, the United States Geological Survey pegged the earthquake at a magnitude of 5.6. Media reports after the quake showed tremors were also felt in New Delhi and surrounding areas.

352.title: Layoffs at Meta to begin on Wednesday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg tells staff: Report
352.article_body: Meta will begin laying off employees on Wednesday morning, said CEO Mark Zuckerberg, reported The Wall Street Journal. Zuckerberg reportedly addressed hundreds of workers on Tuesday and said he was accountable for the firm's missteps and that his overoptimism about growth led to overstaffing. Expected to affect thousands, the layoffs could be the most significant in the company's 18-year history.

353.title: Fire brigade short of 1,200 men in Mumbai; recruitment to start in Dec
353.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) is facing a shortage of 1,200 personnel and 100 drivers and it will take the department at least 10 months to be fully operational, a senior BMC official said. The fire brigade is supposed to run on a total strength of 3,500 men, he added. The recruitment for the fire department will start in December.

354.title: Rashmika shares post on 'receiving lot of hate', calls herself 'punching bag'
354.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna took to Instagram and wrote, "I have been on the receiving end of a lot of hate ever since I started my career. Quite literally a punching bag for a lot of trolls and negativity out there." "It's...demoralising when I'm being ridiculed and mocked by the internet especially for things that I have not said," she said.

355.title: Actor Leslie Phillips, who voiced Sorting Hat in Harry Potter films, passes away aged 98
355.article_body: British actor Leslie Phillips, known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedies and voicing the Sorting Hat in Harry Potter movies, has passed away aged 98. Phillips' agent Jonathan Lloyd confirmed the star died peacefully in his sleep on Monday. The comic actor starred in more than 200 films, and TV and radio series over his eight-decade career.

356.title: US ticket-holder wins $2.04 billion in biggest lottery jackpot in world history
356.article_body: A ticket-holder in US' California won the $2.04-billion Powerball jackpot, believed to be the largest lottery jackpot in world history. The winning ticket was the only one to match all five white balls as well as the Powerball. The odds of matching all six numbers in the drawing were 1 in 292.2 million.

357.title: World Cup-bound referee shows 10 red cards in Argentina cup final
357.article_body: Referee Facundo Tello, who'll be officiating matches in the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup, handed out 10 red cards amid a brawl between Boca Juniors and Racing Club in Argentina's Champions Trophy final. Tello sent off seven Boca players and three from Racing, who won the match 2-1 in extra time. Two red cards were shown before full-time.

358.title: Norwegian princess quits royal duties to work with fiancé who is an American 'shaman'
358.article_body: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway has relinquished her royal duties to focus on her alternative medicine business with her fiancé Durek Verrett, who's a self-proclaimed American shaman. The palace said once they get married, Durek would become a member of the royal family but wouldn't have a title. Norwegian media had accused Märtha of using her title for commercial gain.

359.title: Elon Musk sells Tesla shares worth $3.95 billion after Twitter takeover
359.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk has sold 19.5 million shares of Tesla worth $3.95 billion. With this sale, the total value of Tesla shares sold by Musk since he disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, reached nearly $20 billion. Earlier when he sold Tesla stock in April and August, he said there were no further sales planned.

360.title: Strong tremors felt in Delhi, North India as 6.3-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
360.article_body: A 6.3-magnitude earthquake hit Nepal at around 2 am on Wednesday, as per the initial data by National Center for Seismology. The depth of the earthquake was around 10 km, as per preliminary data. Strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India. On Tuesday night, a 3.5-magnitude earthquake had also struck Nepal.

361.title: Focus on our things, not the negativity around: Leclerc to Ferrari F1
361.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc said the team needs to ignore criticism and focus on the job at hand. "I'm pretty sure that there's a lot of negativity around us...This is not going to help us go anywhere," said Leclerc. He added that F1 is a "very complex" sport and sometimes the criticism is "without any reasons".

362.title: K'taka govt withdraws circular to mobilise 6,500 students for PM's B'luru rally
362.article_body: Karnataka government's Pre University Education Department has withdrawn a circular directing colleges in Bengaluru to send students for PM Narendra Modi's rally in the city. Reacting to the circular which planned to mobilise 6,500 students, Congress spokesperson Nagaraj Yadav said, "Students should be in academic activity...not in rally." "What about their time for studying?" he added.

363.title: Indians are the largest foreign-born group in England, Wales: Data
363.article_body: Nearly one-sixth of the people living in England and Wales in 2021 were born outside the country, according to the census data. Indians constituted the largest group of people born outside England and Wales at 1.5%, followed by Poland (1.2%) and Pakistan (1%). In the UK, London was the region with the largest proportion of people born outside the country.

364.title: Economic reforms by Manmohan Singh gave new direction to India: Gadkari
364.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the country is indebted to former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh for the economic reforms. Gadkari added that liberalisation policies implemented by Singh as finance minister in 1991 gave a new direction to India. "India needs a liberal economic policy with the intention to provide benefits to poor people," he further said.

365.title: Germany raids UBS offices in case involving Russian businessman
365.article_body: German police on Tuesday raided the offices of investment banking company UBS in connection with a money laundering case. The searches were linked to the same probe, involving a Russian businessman, that saw raids on a luxury yacht and more than 20 properties in September, prosecutors said. The subject of the investigation is believed to be Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov.

366.title: European Union sanctions 19 more Myanmar officials
366.article_body: The European Union (EU) sanctioned 19 senior officials and armed forces personnel in Myanmar on Tuesday. The list includes the Foreign Economic Relations Minister, the Chief Justice, top military personnel and businessmen. These individuals are now banned from going to Europe and their assets have been frozen. With this, the EU in total has targeted 84 people and 11 'entities'.

367.title: Pakistan Police file FIR in Imran Khan's assassination bid
367.article_body: Pakistan's Punjab Police on Tuesday filed an FIR on the failed assassination attempt on former Prime Minister Imran Khan's life. The FIR was filed a day after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. The detained attacker has been named the prime accused in the case.

368.title: Choosing Qatar to host WC was a mistake: Ex-FIFA President Blatter
368.article_body: FIFA's President at the time Sepp Blatter said picking Qatar to host the World Cup was a mistake 12 years ago. "It's a country that's too small...Thanks to the four votes of (then UEFA President Michel) Platini and his (UEFA) team, the World Cup went to Qatar," he said. Blatter added that he voted for the United States.

369.title: Don't visualise any problem from the BJP rebels: JP Nadda
369.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that he doesn't visualise any problem from their party rebels who are contesting in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. "When the campaign picks up, the voters understand that they have to vote for the party...Rebels will be further neutralised by the time of the election," Nadda said. However, Nadda admitted that the situation is unusual.

370.title: Winter session of Assam Legislative Assembly to start from Dec 20
370.article_body: According to a statement issued by the Assam Legislative Assembly Secretariat on Tuesday, the winter session of the Assembly will start from December 20. The session will be held at the Assembly Chamber in Dispur. As per the statement, Governor of Assam, Jagdish Mukhi, has summoned the session to meet at 9.30 am on December 20.

371.title: 50 middle school students fall ill after eating midday meal in Bihar
371.article_body: As many as 50 students of a middle school in Bihar's Bhojpur district fell ill after consuming midday meal on Tuesday, officials said. Many students complained of stomach ache and vomiting. The victims were admitted to hospital for treatment and their conditions are reportedly stable. Police said the school administration had given albendazole tablets to students after the meal.

372.title: Farcical: Imran Khan on FIR filed in assassination bid on him
372.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday described the FIR registered on the assassination attempt on him as "farcical". The FIR was filed on Tuesday after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. Khan said he would express his position through his lawyers in the case.

373.title: I was replaced in a show as I had short hair after chemotherapy: Lisa Ray
373.article_body: Actress Lisa Ray, in a conversation with Humans of Bombay, opened up about her battle with cancer and revealed she was replaced in a travel show as she had short hair after chemotherapy. "They wanted a girl with 'long' hair. It was heartbreaking," she added. "I once tried wearing a wig for a public event...I found it...ridiculous," Lisa said.

374.title: Governors being used to encroach upon state govt powers: Kerala CM
374.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan accused the central government of using Governors in non-BJP-ruled states to 'encroach upon the powers of state governments'. "In many states, horse-trading of elected representatives is going on," said Vijayan. He further claimed that attempts were also being made to "financially choke" such states.

375.title: ASI, CRPF constable arrested in J&K police sub-inspector recruitment scam
375.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) of Jammu and Kashmir Police and a constable of the CRPF are among the four people arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in the Jammu and Kashmir Police sub-inspector recruitment scam on Monday. So far, the CBI has arrested 13 people in the case, including security personnel and a teacher.

376.title: England need to win T20 World Cup to achieve greatness: Moeen Ali
376.article_body: All-rounder Moeen Ali said England needs to win more trophies to be considered a great limited-overs team. "It's important we start winning more as a team and as a country...Then we can call ourselves a top side," said Ali. He added that the team haven't performed well in the T20 World Cup so far and is hoping to correct it.

377.title: Armed group decamps with ₹20 lakh from Dera in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
377.article_body: Unidentified gunmen forcibly entered a dera and decamped with ₹20 lakh in cash in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Tuesday. Around 45 people armed with pistols and sharp-edged weapons are reported to have broken into the dera. The group was led by Tarsem Singh and Satvir Singh, who are from Uttar Pradesh, said Deputy Superintendent of Police (Rural) Surinder Pal.

378.title: Man carries 3-yr-old's body for 65 kms on 2-wheeler after being refused ambulance
378.article_body: A video shows a man in Telangana's Khammam district carrying his three-year-old daughter's body on a two-wheeler after he was allegedly denied an ambulance by hospital staff. The child's parents were denied ambulance as there was no free ambulance service available at the time. The man carried his daughter's body for 65 kilometres as he couldn't afford a private ambulance.

379.title: Anand Marriage Act to be implemented in letter, spirit: Punjab CM
379.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said the Anand Marriage Act, which seeks to give statutory recognition to Sikhs' 'Anand Karaj' marriage ceremony, will be implemented in letter and spirit. He said several states like Haryana and Tamil Nadu have already implemented the act. Mann pointed out that a notification to implement the act was issued in Punjab in 2016.

380.title: Boxer Nikhat Zareen recreates 'Saathiya Tune...' with Salman, shares video
380.article_body: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a video with Salman Khan. In the video, the boxer was seen recreating 'Saathiya Tune Kya Kiya' song with Salman. "Finallyyyyy intezar khatam hua (Finally, the wait is over) #fanmoment #dreamcometrue," Nikhat wrote. The song was a part of 'Love', a 1991 film which featured Salman and Revathi.

381.title: Wipro appoints Frederic Abecassis as BFSI head for Southeast Asia
381.article_body: IT company Wipro on Tuesday appointed Frederic Abecassis as the Head of Banking, Financial Services and Insurance (BFSI) Industry Sector, Southeast Asia. Prior to joining Wipro, Abecassis held various leadership roles with Capgemini Invent. According to Wipro, Abecassis, who is based in Hong Kong, will partner with and help clients achieve their core business and digital transformation goals.

382.title: UCC to be implemented throughout states: BJP chief JP Nadda
382.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will be implemented at the state level. Calling the UCC an important issue, he said the ruling party has to run the country 'delicately'. "We have taken this issue state by state and have included it in the Himachal Pradesh manifesto," Nadda said.

383.title: No pressure on Congress workers to join Bharat Jodo Yatra: Kamal Nath
383.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress President Kamal Nath said there was no pressure on party workers to participate in Rahul Gandhi's ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Despite that, all party workers will join it with their hearts," said Nath. He added that the Yatra did not have any political objective but was launched as "our cultural and constitutional institutions are in danger".

384.title: Will focus on sanity, not vanity if Congress wins Guj: Chidambaram
384.article_body: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said if the Congress comes to power in Gujarat, it won't focus on "vanity projects" like the bullet train or Central Vista project. "Every pie should be weighed and spent...You must spend only on sanity projects," said Chidambaram. He added that a government should focus on the needs of the poor like "jobs, houses, water".

385.title: Renault to split into 5 divisions, spin-off EV unit
385.article_body: French automaker Renault on Tuesday announced its plans to split its activities into five businesses. It'll spin-off its electric vehicles unit, codenamed Ampere, with a stock market listing. Further, its combustion-engines unit will be housed in a joint venture with Chinese rival Geely. Its other businesses will cover the Alpine sports car brand, financial services and new mobility products.

386.title: 3 people, including 2 children, drown after boat capsizes in UP
386.article_body: A boat carrying 20 people capsized in Uttar Pradesh, killing three people including two children, police said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath told officials to provide help to the affected families and District Magistrate Avinash Kumar announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the relatives of the deceased. Among those on the boat, 13 people swam to safety.

387.title: ICC names 10 best catches in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
387.article_body: ICC has named 10 best catches in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. It includes Netherlands' Roelof van der Merwe's catch to dismiss David Miller. Catches taken by England's Liam Livingstone, Jos Buttler and Adil Rashid also featured. Babar Azam, Rashid Khan,  Ashen Bandara, Glenn Phillips, Ryan Burl and Rilee Rossouw's catches were also included.

388.title: Lewis Hamilton becomes Brazil's honorary citizen, says 'I feel like now I'm one of you'
388.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has been made an honorary citizen of Brazil. Hamilton dedicated the honour to his boyhood idol, late Brazilian Formula One world champion Ayrton Senna.  "I feel like now I'm one of you," the Mercedes driver said in a session of Brazil's lower house of Congress.

389.title: Indian players to remain away from overseas leagues: IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal
389.article_body: New IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal has stated that contracted Indian players will remain away from overseas leagues. "This in principle is the decision of BCCI... As it is there is so much of cricket happening. Keeping in mind their overall well-being that decision has been taken. As of now we stick to that decision," he added.

390.title: 2 teens run over by train while taking selfie on tracks in Bengal
390.article_body: Two teenagers were run over by a local train while clicking a selfie on railway tracks in West Bengal's Howrah district, Government Railway Police said on Tuesday. The incident took place near Mahishrekha bridge between Kulgachia and Bagnan railway stations on Monday night. The bodies were recovered and handed over to their parents after post-mortem examination, an official said.

391.title: Elephant dies after getting electrocuted in Assam's Nagaon
391.article_body: An adult elephant died of electrocution in Assam's Nagaon district on Tuesday. The incident happened after the elephant strayed into a locality and came in contact with a high-voltage wire that was hanging low, forest officials said. The deceased elephant, which was first spotted by locals at Borholla village, was buried by forest officials with the help of locals.

392.title: 2 US police officers charged after car with handcuffed woman hit by train
392.article_body: Two police officers in US' Colorado state were charged with multiple offences on Monday for allegedly leaving a handcuffed woman in a patrol car parked on railway tracks, where it was struck by a freight train. Yareni Rios-Gonzalez (20) was seriously injured in the incident. She was placed in the car after being detained for an alleged road rage incident.

393.title: Brazil's Pedro proposes to girlfriend minutes after being selected for FIFA World Cup
393.article_body: Brazilian striker Pedro Guilherme proposed to his girlfriend minutes after being named in Brazil's squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup. The 25-year-old shared pictures after getting engaged and wrote, "God is so good, so grateful to God for having this woman in my life. Thank you for making me grow in every area most especially as a man of God."

394.title: Union Minister Anurag Thakur pushes bus to clear jam in Himachal, video surfaces
394.article_body: Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur was seen pushing a bus that had broken down in the middle of the road in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, causing a traffic jam. The minister was seen participating in efforts to clear the road after his convoy got stuck. Thakur, whose father is a former Himachal CM, is in the state for poll rallies.

395.title: Leslie Phillips, voice of Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passes away
395.article_body: Leslie Phillips, the British actor who voiced the Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passed away aged 98. His agent, Jonathan Lloyd, said that he died "peacefully at home" on Monday. Leslie's wife Zara said, "I've lost a wonderful husband and...public has lost a truly great showman." Leslie was also known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedy films.

396.title: EU opens investigation into Microsoft's $69 bn Activision bid
396.article_body: European Union antitrust regulators opened an investigation into Microsoft's $69 billion bid for 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The regulatory commission said that the transaction may distort competition in the market and it is concerned that Microsoft may not provide access to Activision's console and PC video games. Microsoft announced the agreement to buy Activision in January.

397.title: PM Modi is popular in world, nobody has leadership qualities like him: Nadda
397.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that PM Narendra Modi is popular across the world and nobody has leadership qualities like him. "There is no second thought that PM Modi is our most towering personality," Nadda said in an interview. He added, "It is our pride that he is our commander and PM Modi has personal bonding with Himachal Pradesh."

398.title: 27 girls missing from Rajasthan village, says NCPCR; orders probe
398.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) Chairperson Priyank Kanoongo said that a probe has been ordered over 27 girls who went missing from their village in Rajasthan. The village has been allegedly selling girls on government stamp papers. Kanoongo visited the village after a notice was issued to the Rajasthan government on the reported auctioning of girls.

399.title: 2 drug smugglers arrested in J&K's Udhampur, 27 kg poppy seized
399.article_body: Two inter-state drug smugglers were arrested on Tuesday in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district and 27 kg of poppy was seized from their possession, officials said. The arrests were made after a truck was intercepted at Jakhani Chowk on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Truck driver Sukhdev Singh and his accomplice Harpreet Singh were arrested.

400.title: MBBS, BDS seats reserved for children of terror victims in J&K
400.article_body: The Centre has decided to reserve seats in MBBS and BDS courses for the spouse and children of terrorist victims in Jammu and Kashmir. Seats will be reserved from the central pool for academic year 2022-23. Children whose both parents were killed by terrorists would get the first priority, followed by children of families whose sole bread earners were slain.
